Hebrew: דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֗ה אֶל־הוֹשֵׁ֙עַ֙ בֶּן־בְּאֵרִ֔י בִּימֵ֨י עֻזִּיָּ֥ה יוֹתָ֛ם אָחָ֥ז יְחִזְקִיָּ֖ה מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וּבִימֵ֛י יָרׇבְעָ֥ם בֶּן־יוֹאָ֖שׁ מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the reigns of Kings Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah of Judah, and in the reign of King Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel.
Transliteration: devar-yehovah asher hayah el-hvoshea ven-veeriy viymey uziyah yvotam achaz yechizekiyah malekhey yehudah uviymey yarׇveam ven-yvoash melekhe yisherael

Hebrew:
תְּחִלַּ֥ת דִּבֶּר־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּהוֹשֵׁ֑עַ {פ}
וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־הוֹשֵׁ֗עַ לֵ֣ךְ קַח־לְךָ֞ אֵ֤שֶׁת זְנוּנִים֙ וְיַלְדֵ֣י זְנוּנִ֔ים כִּֽי־זָנֹ֤ה תִזְנֶה֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When G<small>OD</small> first spoke to Hosea, G<small>OD</small> said to Hosea, “Go, get yourself a wife of whoredom and children of whoredom; for the land will stray from following G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration:
techilat diver-yehovah vehvoshea {f}
vayomer yehovah el-hvoshea lekhe kach-lekha eshet zenuniym veyaledey zenuniym khiy-zanoh tizeneh haarets meacharey yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיִּקַּ֔ח אֶת־גֹּ֖מֶר בַּת־דִּבְלָ֑יִם וַתַּ֥הַר וַתֵּלֶד־ל֖וֹ בֵּֽן׃
Translated: So he went and married Gomer daughter of Diblaim. She conceived and bore him a son,
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayikach et-gomer vat-divelayiim vatahar vateled-lvo ven

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלָ֔יו קְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יִזְרְעֶ֑אל כִּי־ע֣וֹד מְעַ֗ט וּפָ֨קַדְתִּ֜י אֶת־דְּמֵ֤י יִזְרְעֶאל֙ עַל־בֵּ֣ית יֵה֔וּא וְהִ֨שְׁבַּתִּ֔י מַמְלְכ֖וּת בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and G<small>OD</small> instructed him, “Name him Jezreel; for, I will soon punish the House of Jehu for the bloody deeds at Jezreel and put an end to the monarchy of the House of Israel.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elayv kera shemvo yizereel khiy-vod meat ufakadetiy et-demey yizereel al-veyt eihu vehishevatiy mamelekhut veyt yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וְשָֽׁבַרְתִּי֙ אֶת־קֶ֣שֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּעֵ֖מֶק יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated: In that day, I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu veshavaretiy et-keshet yisherael veemek yizereel

Hebrew: וַתַּ֤הַר עוֹד֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בַּ֔ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ קְרָ֥א שְׁמָ֖הּ לֹ֣א רֻחָ֑מָה כִּי֩ לֹ֨א אוֹסִ֜יף ע֗וֹד אֲרַחֵם֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּֽי־נָשֹׂ֥א אֶשָּׂ֖א לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: She conceived again and bore a daughter; and he was told, “Name her Lo-ruhamah; for I will no longer accept the House of Israel or pardon them.
Transliteration: vatahar vod vateled vat vayomer lvo kera shemah lo ruchamah khiy lo vosiyf vod arachem et-veyt yisherael khiy-nasho esha lahem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בֵּ֤ית יְהוּדָה֙ אֲרַחֵ֔ם וְהוֹשַׁעְתִּ֖ים בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וְלֹ֣א אוֹשִׁיעֵ֗ם בְּקֶ֤שֶׁת וּבְחֶ֙רֶב֙ וּבְמִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּסוּסִ֖ים וּבְפָרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: (But I will accept the House of Judah. And I will give them victory through the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God; I will not give them victory with bow and sword and battle, by horses and riders.)”
Transliteration: veet-veyt yehudah arachem vehvoshaetiym vayhovah eloheyhem velo voshiyem vekeshet uvecherev uvemilechamah vesusiym uvefarashiym

Hebrew: וַתִּגְמֹ֖ל אֶת־לֹ֣א רֻחָ֑מָה וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֥לֶד בֵּֽן׃
Translated: After weaning Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.
Transliteration: vatigemol et-lo ruchamah vatahar vateled ven

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר קְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ לֹ֣א עַמִּ֑י כִּ֤י אַתֶּם֙ לֹ֣א עַמִּ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹא־אֶהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then [God] said, “Name him Lo-ammi; for you are not My people, and I will not be your [God].”
Transliteration: vayomer kera shemvo lo amiy khiy atem lo amiy veanokhiy lo-eheyeh lakhem {f}

Hebrew: וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה מִסְפַּ֤ר בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כְּח֣וֹל הַיָּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יִמַּ֖ד וְלֹ֣א יִסָּפֵ֑ר וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה בִּמְק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יֵאָמֵ֤ר לָהֶם֙ לֹא־עַמִּ֣י אַתֶּ֔ם יֵאָמֵ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י אֵֽל־חָֽי׃
Translated: The number of the people of Israel shall be like that of the sands of the sea, which cannot be measured or counted; and instead of being told, “You are Not-My-People,” they shall be called Children-of-the-Living-God.
Transliteration: vehayah misefar veney-yisherael khechvol hayam asher lo-yimad velo yisafer vehayah vimekvom asher-eiamer lahem lo-amiy atem eiamer lahem veney el-chay

Hebrew: וְ֠נִקְבְּצ֠וּ בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֤ה וּבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו וְשָׂמ֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם רֹ֥אשׁ אֶחָ֖ד וְעָל֣וּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י גָד֖וֹל י֥וֹם יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated: The people of Judah and the people of Israel shall assemble together and appoint one head over them; and they shall rise from the ground—for marvelous shall be the day of Jezreel!
Transliteration: venikevetsu veney-yehudah uveney-yisherael yachedav veshamu lahem rosh echad vealu min-haarets khiy gadvol yvom yizereel

Hebrew: אִמְר֥וּ לַאֲחֵיכֶ֖ם עַמִּ֑י וְלַאֲחוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם רֻחָֽמָה׃
Translated:
Oh, call your brothers “My People,”
And your sisters “Lovingly Accepted!”
Transliteration: imeru laacheykhem amiy velaachvoteykhem ruchamah

Hebrew: רִ֤יבוּ בְאִמְּכֶם֙ רִ֔יבוּ כִּי־הִיא֙ לֹ֣א אִשְׁתִּ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֣א אִישָׁ֑הּ וְתָסֵ֤ר זְנוּנֶ֙יהָ֙ מִפָּנֶ֔יהָ וְנַאֲפוּפֶ֖יהָ מִבֵּ֥ין שָׁדֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Remonstrate your mother, remonstrate her—
For she is not My wife
And I am not her husband—
And let her put away her whoredom from her face
And her adultery from between her breasts.
Transliteration: riyvu veimekhem riyvu khiy-hiy lo ishetiy veanokhiy lo iyshah vetaser zenuneyha mifaneyha venaafufeyha miveyn shadeyha

Hebrew: פֶּן־אַפְשִׁיטֶ֣נָּה עֲרֻמָּ֔ה וְהִ֨צַּגְתִּ֔יהָ כְּי֖וֹם הִוָּֽלְדָ֑הּ וְשַׂמְתִּ֣יהָ כַמִּדְבָּ֗ר וְשַׁתִּ֙הָ֙ כְּאֶ֣רֶץ צִיָּ֔ה וַהֲמִתִּ֖יהָ בַּצָּמָֽא׃
Translated:
Else will I strip her naked
And leave her as on the day she was born:
And I will make her like a wilderness,
Render her like desert land,
And let her die of thirst.
Transliteration: fen-afeshiytenah arumah vehitsagetiyha kheyvom hivaledah veshametiyha khamidevar veshatiha kheerets tsiyah vahamitiyha vatsama

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּנֶ֖יהָ לֹ֣א אֲרַחֵ֑ם כִּֽי־בְנֵ֥י זְנוּנִ֖ים הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
I will also disown her children;
For they are now a whore’s brood,
Transliteration: veet-vaneyha lo arachem khiy-veney zenuniym hemah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י זָֽנְתָה֙ אִמָּ֔ם הֹבִ֖ישָׁה הוֹרָתָ֑ם כִּ֣י אָמְרָ֗ה אֵלְכָ֞ה אַחֲרֵ֤י מְאַֽהֲבַי֙ נֹתְנֵ֤י לַחְמִי֙ וּמֵימַ֔י צַמְרִ֣י וּפִשְׁתִּ֔י שַׁמְנִ֖י וְשִׁקּוּיָֽי׃
Translated:
In that their mother has played the whore,
She that conceived them has acted shamelessly—
Because she thought,
“I will go after my lovers,
Who supply my bread and my water,
My wool and my linen,
My oil and my drink.”
Transliteration: khiy zanetah imam hoviyshah hvoratam khiy amerah elekhah acharey meahavay noteney lachemiy umeymay tsameriy ufishetiy shameniy veshikuyay

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן הִנְנִי־שָׂ֥ךְ אֶת־דַּרְכֵּ֖ךְ בַּסִּירִ֑ים וְגָֽדַרְתִּי֙ אֶת־גְּדֵרָ֔הּ וּנְתִיבוֹתֶ֖יהָ לֹ֥א תִמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
I will hedge up her roads with thorns
And raise walls against her,
And she shall not find her paths.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy-shakhe et-darekhekhe vasiyriym vegadaretiy et-gederah unetiyvvoteyha lo timetsa

Hebrew: וְרִדְּפָ֤ה אֶת־מְאַהֲבֶ֙יהָ֙ וְלֹא־תַשִּׂ֣יג אֹתָ֔ם וּבִקְשָׁ֖תַם וְלֹ֣א תִמְצָ֑א וְאָמְרָ֗ה אֵלְכָ֤ה וְאָשׁ֙וּבָה֙ אֶל־אִישִׁ֣י הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן כִּ֣י ט֥וֹב לִ֛י אָ֖ז מֵעָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Pursue her lovers as she will,
She shall not overtake them;
And seek them as she may,
She shall never find them.
Then she will say,
“I will go and return
To my first husband,
For then I fared better than now.”
Transliteration: veridefah et-meahaveyha velo-tashiyg otam uvikeshatam velo timetsa veamerah elekhah veashuvah el-iyshiy harishvon khiy tvov liy az meatah

Hebrew: וְהִיא֙ לֹ֣א יָֽדְעָ֔ה כִּ֤י אָֽנֹכִי֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔הּ הַדָּגָ֖ן וְהַתִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָ֑ר וְכֶ֨סֶף הִרְבֵּ֥יתִי לָ֛הּ וְזָהָ֖ב עָשׂ֥וּ לַבָּֽעַל׃
Translated:
And she did not consider this:
It was I who bestowed on her
The new grain and wine and oil;
I who lavished silver on her
And gold—which they used for Baal.
Transliteration: vehiy lo yadeah khiy anokhiy natatiy lah hadagan vehatiyrvosh vehayitsehar vekhesef hireveytiy lah vezahav ashu lavaal

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן אָשׁ֔וּב וְלָקַחְתִּ֤י דְגָנִי֙ בְּעִתּ֔וֹ וְתִירוֹשִׁ֖י בְּמוֹעֲד֑וֹ וְהִצַּלְתִּי֙ צַמְרִ֣י וּפִשְׁתִּ֔י לְכַסּ֖וֹת אֶת־עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
I will take back My new grain in its time
And My new wine in its season,
And I will snatch away My wool and My linen
That serve to cover her nakedness.
Transliteration: lakhen ashuv velakachetiy deganiy veitvo vetiyrvoshiy vemvoadvo vehitsaletiy tsameriy ufishetiy lekhasvot et-erevatah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֛ה אֲגַלֶּ֥ה אֶת־נַבְלֻתָ֖הּ לְעֵינֵ֣י מְאַהֲבֶ֑יהָ וְאִ֖ישׁ לֹא־יַצִּילֶ֥נָּה מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated:
Now will I uncover her shame
In the very sight of her lovers,
And not one of them shall save her from Me.
Transliteration: veatah agaleh et-navelutah leeyney meahaveyha veiysh lo-yatsiylenah miyadiy

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבַּתִּי֙ כׇּל־מְשׂוֹשָׂ֔הּ חַגָּ֖הּ חׇדְשָׁ֣הּ וְשַׁבַּתָּ֑הּ וְכֹ֖ל מוֹעֲדָֽהּ׃
Translated:
And I will end all her rejoicing:
Her festivals, new moons, and sabbaths—
All her festive seasons.
Transliteration: vehishevatiy khׇl-meshvoshah chagah chׇdeshah veshavatah vekhol mvoadah

Hebrew: וַהֲשִׁמֹּתִ֗י גַּפְנָהּ֙ וּתְאֵ֣נָתָ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמְרָ֗ה אֶתְנָ֥ה הֵ֙מָּה֙ לִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתְנוּ־לִ֖י מְאַהֲבָ֑י וְשַׂמְתִּ֣ים לְיַ֔עַר וַאֲכָלָ֖תַם חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
I will lay waste her vines and her fig trees,
Which she thinks are a fee
She received from her lovers;
I will turn them into brushwood,
And beasts of the field shall devour them.
Transliteration: vahashimotiy gafenah uteenatah asher amerah etenah hemah liy asher natenu-liy meahavay veshametiym leyaar vaakhalatam chayat hashadeh

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֣י עָלֶ֗יהָ אֶת־יְמֵ֤י הַבְּעָלִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּקְטִ֣יר לָהֶ֔ם וַתַּ֤עַד נִזְמָהּ֙ וְחֶלְיָתָ֔הּ וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ אַחֲרֵ֣י מְאַהֲבֶ֑יהָ וְאֹתִ֥י שָׁכְחָ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Thus will I punish her
For the days of the Baalim,
On which she brought them offerings;
When, decked with earrings and jewels,
She would go after her lovers,
Forgetting Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy aleyha et-yemey havealiym asher taketiyr lahem vataad nizemah vecheleyatah vatelekhe acharey meahaveyha veotiy shakhechah neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן הִנֵּ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ מְפַתֶּ֔יהָ וְהֹלַכְתִּ֖יהָ הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְדִבַּרְתִּ֖י עַל־לִבָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
I will speak coaxingly to her
And lead her through the wilderness
And speak to her tenderly.
Transliteration: lakhen hineh anokhiy mefateyha veholakhetiyha hamidevar vedivaretiy al-livah

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֨תִּי לָ֤הּ אֶת־כְּרָמֶ֙יהָ֙ מִשָּׁ֔ם וְאֶת־עֵ֥מֶק עָכ֖וֹר לְפֶ֣תַח תִּקְוָ֑ה וְעָ֤נְתָה שָּׁ֙מָּה֙ כִּימֵ֣י נְעוּרֶ֔יהָ וּכְי֖וֹם עֲלוֹתָ֥הּ מֵאֶרֶץ־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
I will give her her vineyards from there,
And the Valley of Achor as a plowland of hope.
There she shall respond as in the days of her youth,
When she came up from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: venatatiy lah et-kherameyha misham veet-emek akhvor lefetach tikevah veanetah shamah khiymey neureyha ukheyvom alvotah meerets-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה בַיּוֹם־הַהוּא֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה תִּקְרְאִ֖י אִישִׁ֑י וְלֹא־תִקְרְאִי־לִ֥י ע֖וֹד בַּעְלִֽי׃
Translated:
And in that day
—declares GOD—
You will call [Me] Ishi,
And no more will you call Me Baali.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom-hahu neum-yehovah tikereiy iyshiy velo-tikereiy-liy vod vaeliy

Hebrew: וַהֲסִרֹתִ֛י אֶת־שְׁמ֥וֹת הַבְּעָלִ֖ים מִפִּ֑יהָ וְלֹא־יִזָּכְר֥וּ ע֖וֹד בִּשְׁמָֽם׃
Translated:
For I will remove the names of the Baalim from her mouth,
And they shall nevermore be mentioned by name.
Transliteration: vahasirotiy et-shemvot havealiym mifiyha velo-yizakheru vod vishemam

Hebrew: וְכָרַתִּ֨י לָהֶ֤ם בְּרִית֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא עִם־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְעִם־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְרֶ֖מֶשׂ הָאֲדָמָ֑ה וְקֶ֨שֶׁת וְחֶ֤רֶב וּמִלְחָמָה֙ אֶשְׁבּ֣וֹר מִן־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהִשְׁכַּבְתִּ֖ים לָבֶֽטַח׃
Translated: In that day, I will make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, the birds of the air, and the creeping things of the ground; I will also banish bow, sword, and war from the land. Thus I will let them lie down in safety.
Transliteration: vekharatiy lahem veriyt vayyvom hahu im-chayat hashadeh veim-vof hashamayiim veremesh haadamah vekeshet vecherev umilechamah eshevvor min-haarets vehishekhavetiym lavetach

Hebrew: וְאֵרַשְׂתִּ֥יךְ לִ֖י לְעוֹלָ֑ם וְאֵרַשְׂתִּ֥יךְ לִי֙ בְּצֶ֣דֶק וּבְמִשְׁפָּ֔ט וּבְחֶ֖סֶד וּֽבְרַחֲמִֽים׃
Translated:
And I will espouse you forever:
I will espouse you with righteousness and justice,
And with goodness and mercy,
Transliteration: veerashetiykhe liy levolam veerashetiykhe liy vetsedek uvemishefat uvechesed uverachamiym

Hebrew: וְאֵרַשְׂתִּ֥יךְ לִ֖י בֶּאֱמוּנָ֑ה וְיָדַ֖עַתְּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
And I will espouse you with faithfulness;
Then you shall be devoted to GOD.
Transliteration: veerashetiykhe liy veemunah veyadaate et-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא אֶֽעֱנֶה֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶעֱנֶ֖ה אֶת־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְהֵ֖ם יַעֲנ֥וּ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
In that day,
I will respond
—declares GOD—
I will respond to the sky,
And it shall respond to the earth;
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu eeneh neum-yehovah eeneh et-hashamayiim vehem yaanu et-haarets

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֣רֶץ תַּעֲנֶ֔ה אֶת־הַדָּגָ֖ן וְאֶת־הַתִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְאֶת־הַיִּצְהָ֑ר וְהֵ֖ם יַעֲנ֥וּ אֶֽת־יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated:
And the earth shall respond
With new grain and wine and oil,
And they shall respond to Jezreel.
Transliteration: vehaarets taaneh et-hadagan veet-hatiyrvosh veet-hayitsehar vehem yaanu et-yizereel

Hebrew: וּזְרַעְתִּ֤יהָ לִּי֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְרִחַמְתִּ֖י אֶת־לֹ֣א רֻחָ֑מָה וְאָמַרְתִּ֤י לְלֹֽא־עַמִּי֙ עַמִּי־אַ֔תָּה וְה֖וּא יֹאמַ֥ר אֱלֹהָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will sow her in the land as My own;
And take Lo-ruhamah back in favor;
And I will say to Lo-ammi, “You are My people,”
And he will respond, “[You are] my God.”
Transliteration: uzeraetiyha liy vaarets verichametiy et-lo ruchamah veamaretiy lelo-amiy amiy-atah vehu yomar elohay {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י ע֚וֹד לֵ֣ךְ אֱֽהַב־אִשָּׁ֔ה אֲהֻ֥בַת רֵ֖עַ וּמְנָאָ֑פֶת כְּאַהֲבַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהֵ֗ם פֹּנִים֙ אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְאֹהֲבֵ֖י אֲשִׁישֵׁ֥י עֲנָבִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to me further, “Go, befriend a woman who, while befriended by a companion, consorts with others, just as G<small>OD</small> befriends the Israelites, but they turn to other gods and love the cups of the grape.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay vod lekhe ehav-ishah ahuvat rea umenaafet kheahavat yehovah et-veney yisherael vehem foniym el-Elohim acheriym veohavey ashiyshey anaviym

Hebrew: וָאֶכְּרֶ֣הָ לִּ֔י בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר כָּ֑סֶף וְחֹ֥מֶר שְׂעֹרִ֖ים וְלֵ֥תֶךְ שְׂעֹרִֽים׃
Translated: Then I hired her for fifteen [shekels of] silver, a ḥomer of barley, and a lethech of barley;
Transliteration: vaekhereha liy vachamishah ashar khasef vechomer sheoriym veletekhe sheoriym

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֗יהָ יָמִ֤ים רַבִּים֙ תֵּ֣שְׁבִי לִ֔י לֹ֣א תִזְנִ֔י וְלֹ֥א תִֽהְיִ֖י לְאִ֑ישׁ וְגַם־אֲנִ֖י אֵלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: and I stipulated with her, “In return, you are to go a long time without either fornicating or marrying; even I [shall not cohabit] with you.”
Transliteration: vaomar eleyha yamiym raviym tesheviy liy lo tizeniy velo tiheyiy leiysh vegam-aniy elayiikhe

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים יֵֽשְׁבוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֥ין מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ וְאֵ֣ין שָׂ֔ר וְאֵ֥ין זֶ֖בַח וְאֵ֣ין מַצֵּבָ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין אֵפ֖וֹד וּתְרָפִֽים׃
Translated: For the Israelites shall go a long time without king and without officials, without sacrifice and without cult pillars, and without ephod and oracle idols.
Transliteration: khiy yamiym raviym eishevu veney yisherael eyn melekhe veeyn shar veeyn zevach veeyn matsevah veeyn efvod uterafiym

Hebrew: אַחַ֗ר יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּבִקְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת דָּוִ֣יד מַלְכָּ֑ם וּפָחֲד֧וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֛ה וְאֶל־טוּב֖וֹ בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Afterward, the Israelites will turn back and will seek the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God and David their king—and they will thrill over G<small>OD</small> and over God’s bounty in the days to come.
Transliteration: achar yashuvu veney yisherael uvikeshu et-yehovah eloheyhem veet daviyd malekham ufachadu el-yehovah veel-tuvvo veachariyt hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֣י רִ֤יב לַֽיהֹוָה֙ עִם־יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֠י אֵין־אֱמֶ֧ת וְֽאֵין־חֶ֛סֶד וְאֵֽין־דַּ֥עַת אֱלֹהִ֖ים בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Hear the word of GOD,
O people of Israel!
For GOD has a case
Against the inhabitants of this land,
Because there is no honesty and no goodness
And no devotion to God in the land.
Transliteration: shimeu devar-yehovah veney yisherael khiy riyv layhovah im-yvoshevey haarets khiy eyn-emet veeyn-chesed veeyn-daat Elohim vaarets

Hebrew: אָלֹ֣ה וְכַחֵ֔שׁ וְרָצֹ֥חַ וְגָנֹ֖ב וְנָאֹ֑ף פָּרָ֕צוּ וְדָמִ֥ים בְּדָמִ֖ים נָגָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
[False] swearing, dishonesty, and murder,
And theft and adultery are rife;
Crime follows upon crime!
Transliteration: aloh vekhachesh veratsocha veganov venaof faratsu vedamiym vedamiym nagau

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֣ן ׀ תֶּאֱבַ֣ל הָאָ֗רֶץ וְאֻמְלַל֙ כׇּל־יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּ֔הּ בְּחַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְגַם־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֖ם יֵאָסֵֽפוּ׃
Translated:
For that, the earth is withered:
Everything that dwells on it languishes—
Beasts of the field and birds of the sky—
Even the fish of the sea perish.
Transliteration: al-khen teeval haarets veumelal khׇl-yvoshev vah vechayat hashadeh uvevof hashamayiim vegam-degey hayam eiasefu

Hebrew: אַ֥ךְ אִ֛ישׁ אַל־יָרֵ֖ב וְאַל־יוֹכַ֣ח אִ֑ישׁ וְעַמְּךָ֖ כִּמְרִיבֵ֥י כֹהֵֽן׃
Translated:
“Absolutely no one shall rebuke; none shall protest!”
For this, your people has a grievance against [you], O priest!
Transliteration: akhe iysh al-yarev veal-yvokhach iysh veamekha khimeriyvey khohen

Hebrew: וְכָשַׁלְתָּ֣ הַיּ֔וֹם וְכָשַׁ֧ל גַּם־נָבִ֛יא עִמְּךָ֖ לָ֑יְלָה וְדָמִ֖יתִי אִמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
So you shall stumble by day,
And by night a prophet shall stumble as well,
And I will destroy your kindred.
Transliteration: vekhashaleta hayyvom vekhashal gam-naviy imekha layelah vedamiytiy imekha

Hebrew: נִדְמ֥וּ עַמִּ֖י מִבְּלִ֣י הַדָּ֑עַת כִּי־אַתָּ֞ה הַדַּ֣עַת מָאַ֗סְתָּ (ואמאסאך) [וְאֶמְאָֽסְךָ֙] מִכַּהֵ֣ן לִ֔י וַתִּשְׁכַּח֙ תּוֹרַ֣ת אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֶשְׁכַּ֥ח בָּנֶ֖יךָ גַּם־אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
My people is destroyed for the lack of devotion!
Because you have rejected devotion,
I reject you as My priest;
Because you have spurned the teaching of your God,
I, in turn, will spurn your children.
Transliteration: nidemu amiy miveliy hadaat khiy-atah hadaat maaseta (vmskh) [veemeasekha] mikhahen liy vatishekhach tvorat eloheykha eshekhach vaneykha gam-aniy

Hebrew: כְּרֻבָּ֖ם כֵּ֣ן חָטְאוּ־לִ֑י כְּבוֹדָ֖ם בְּקָל֥וֹן אָמִֽיר׃
Translated:
The more they increased, the more they sinned against Me:
I will change their dignity to dishonor.
Transliteration: kheruvam khen chateu-liy khevvodam vekalvon amiyr

Hebrew: חַטַּ֥את עַמִּ֖י יֹאכֵ֑לוּ וְאֶל־עֲוֺנָ֖ם יִשְׂא֥וּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
They feed on My people’s purgation offerings,
And so they desire its iniquity.
Transliteration: chatat amiy yokhelu veel-avonam yisheu nafeshvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה כָעָ֖ם כַּכֹּהֵ֑ן וּפָקַדְתִּ֤י עָלָיו֙ דְּרָכָ֔יו וּמַעֲלָלָ֖יו אָשִׁ֥יב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Therefore, the people shall fare like the priests:
I will punish it for its conduct,
I will requite it for its deeds.
Transliteration: vehayah khaam khakhohen ufakadetiy alayv derakhayv umaalalayv ashiyv lvo

Hebrew: וְאָֽכְלוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׂבָּ֔עוּ הִזְנ֖וּ וְלֹ֣א יִפְרֹ֑צוּ כִּֽי־אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה עָזְב֖וּ לִשְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated:
Truly, they shall eat, but not be sated;
They shall swill, but not be satisfied,
Because they have forsaken GOD
To practice
Transliteration: veakhelu velo yishevau hizenu velo yiferotsu khiy-et-yehovah azevu lishemor

Hebrew: זְנ֛וּת וְיַ֥יִן וְתִיר֖וֹשׁ יִֽקַּֽח־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
lechery.
Wine and new wine destroy
The mind of
Transliteration: zenut veyayiin vetiyrvosh yikach-lev

Hebrew: עַמִּי֙ בְּעֵצ֣וֹ יִשְׁאָ֔ל וּמַקְל֖וֹ יַגִּ֣יד ל֑וֹ כִּ֣י ר֤וּחַ זְנוּנִים֙ הִתְעָ֔ה וַיִּזְנ֖וּ מִתַּ֥חַת אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
My people:
It consults its stick,
Its rod directs it!
A lecherous impulse has made them go wrong,
And they have strayed from submission to their God.
Transliteration: amiy veetsvo yisheal umakelvo yagiyd lvo khiy rucha zenuniym hiteah vayizenu mitachat eloheyhem

Hebrew: עַל־רָאשֵׁ֨י הֶהָרִ֜ים יְזַבֵּ֗חוּ וְעַל־הַגְּבָעוֹת֙ יְקַטֵּ֔רוּ תַּ֣חַת אַלּ֧וֹן וְלִבְנֶ֛ה וְאֵלָ֖ה כִּ֣י ט֣וֹב צִלָּ֑הּ עַל־כֵּ֗ן תִּזְנֶ֙ינָה֙ בְּנ֣וֹתֵיכֶ֔ם וְכַלּוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם תְּנָאַֽפְנָה׃
Translated:
They sacrifice on the mountaintops
And offer on the hills,
Under oaks, poplars, and terebinths
Whose shade is so pleasant.
That is why their daughters fornicate
And their daughters-in-law commit adultery!
Transliteration: al-rashey hehariym yezavechu veal-hagevavot yekateru tachat alvon veliveneh veelah khiy tvov tsilah al-khen tizeneynah venvoteykhem vekhalvoteykhem tenaafenah

Hebrew: לֹא־אֶפְק֨וֹד עַל־בְּנוֹתֵיכֶ֜ם כִּ֣י תִזְנֶ֗ינָה וְעַל־כַּלּֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ כִּ֣י תְנָאַ֔פְנָה כִּי־הֵם֙ עִם־הַזֹּנ֣וֹת יְפָרֵ֔דוּ וְעִם־הַקְּדֵשׁ֖וֹת יְזַבֵּ֑חוּ וְעָ֥ם לֹֽא־יָבִ֖ין יִלָּבֵֽט׃
Translated:
I will not punish their daughters for fornicating
Nor their daughters-in-law for committing adultery;
For they themselves turn aside with whores
And sacrifice with female consecrated workers,
And a people that is without sense must stumble.
Transliteration: lo-efekvod al-venvoteykhem khiy tizeneynah veal-khalvoteykhem khiy tenaafenah khiy-hem im-hazonvot yefaredu veim-hakedeshvot yezavechu veam lo-yaviyn yilavet

Hebrew: אִם־זֹנֶ֤ה אַתָּה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַל־יֶאְשַׁ֖ם יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאַל־תָּבֹ֣אוּ הַגִּלְגָּ֗ל וְאַֽל־תַּעֲלוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן וְאַל־תִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ חַי־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
If you are a lecher, Israel—
Let not Judah incur guilt—
Do not come to Gilgal,
Do not make pilgrimages to Beth-aven,
And do not swear by GOD!
Transliteration: im-zoneh atah yisherael al-yeesham yehudah veal-tavou hagilegal veal-taalu veyt aven veal-tishaveu chay-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֚י כְּפָרָ֣ה סֹרֵרָ֔ה סָרַ֖ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַתָּה֙ יִרְעֵ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּכֶ֖בֶשׂ בַּמֶּרְחָֽב׃
Translated:
Ah, Israel has balked
Like a stubborn cow;
Therefore,
GOD will graze him
On the range, like a sheep.
Transliteration: khiy khefarah sorerah sarar yisherael atah yireem yehovah khekhevesh vamerechav

Hebrew: חֲב֧וּר עֲצַבִּ֛ים אֶפְרָ֖יִם הַֽנַּֽח־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Ephraim is addicted to images—
Let him be.
Transliteration: chavur atsaviym eferayiim hanach-lvo

Hebrew: סָ֖ר סׇבְאָ֑ם הַזְנֵ֣ה הִזְנ֔וּ אָהֲב֥וּ הֵב֛וּ קָל֖וֹן מָגִנֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
They drink to excess—
Their liquor turns against them.
They “love” beyond measure—
Disgrace is the “gift”
Transliteration: sar sׇveam hazeneh hizenu ahavu hevu kalvon magineyha

Hebrew: צָרַ֥ר ר֛וּחַ אוֹתָ֖הּ בִּכְנָפֶ֑יהָ וְיֵבֹ֖שׁוּ מִזִּבְחוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
That the wind is bringing;
They shall garner shame from their sacrifices.
Transliteration: tsarar rucha votah vikhenafeyha veeivoshu mizivechvotam {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֨את הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים וְהַקְשִׁ֣יבוּ ׀ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּבֵ֤ית הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַאֲזִ֔ינוּ כִּ֥י לָכֶ֖ם הַמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּי־פַח֙ הֱיִיתֶ֣ם לְמִצְפָּ֔ה וְרֶ֖שֶׁת פְּרוּשָׂ֥ה עַל־תָּבֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Hear this, O priests,
Attend, O House of Israel,
And give ear, O royal house;
For right conduct is your responsibility!
But you have been a snare to Mizpah
And a net spread out over Tabor;
Transliteration: shimeu-zot hakhohaniym vehakeshiyvu veyt yisherael uveyt hamelekhe haaziynu khiy lakhem hamishefat khiy-fach heyiytem lemitsefah vereshet ferushah al-tavvor

Hebrew: וְשַׁחֲטָ֥ה שֵׂטִ֖ים הֶעְמִ֑יקוּ וַאֲנִ֖י מוּסָ֥ר לְכֻלָּֽם׃
Translated:
For when trappers dug deep pitfalls,
I was the only reprover of them all.
Transliteration: veshachatah shetiym heemiyku vaaniy musar lekhulam

Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹא־נִכְחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֑נִּי כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ הִזְנֵ֣יתָ אֶפְרַ֔יִם נִטְמָ֖א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Yes, I have watched Ephraim,
Israel has not escaped my notice:
Behold, you have fornicated, O Ephraim;
Israel has defiled himself!
Transliteration: aniy yadaetiy eferayiim veyisherael lo-nikhechad mimeniy khiy atah hizeneyta eferayiim nitema yisherael

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יִתְּנוּ֙ מַ֣עַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם לָשׁ֖וּב אֶל־אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ר֤וּחַ זְנוּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔ם וְאֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֥א יָדָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Their habits do not let them
Turn back to their God;
Because of the lecherous impulse within them,
They pay no heed to GOD.
Transliteration: lo yitenu maaleleyhem lashuv el-eloheyhem khiy rucha zenuniym vekirevam veet-yehovah lo yadau

Hebrew: וְעָנָ֥ה גְאֽוֹן־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָנָ֑יו וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וְאֶפְרַ֗יִם יִכָּֽשְׁלוּ֙ בַּעֲוֺנָ֔ם כָּשַׁ֥ל גַּם־יְהוּדָ֖ה עִמָּֽם׃
Translated:
Israel’s pride shall be humbled before his very eyes,
As Israel and Ephraim fall because of their sin
(And Judah falls with them).
Transliteration: veanah gevon-yisherael vefanayv veyisherael veeferayiim yikhashelu vaavonam khashal gam-yehudah imam

Hebrew: בְּצֹאנָ֣ם וּבִבְקָרָ֗ם יֵ֥לְכ֛וּ לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָ֑אוּ חָלַ֖ץ מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Then they will go with their sheep and cattle
To seek GOD—whom they will not find.
They have been cast off:
Transliteration: vetsonam uvivekaram eilekhu levakesh et-yehovah velo yimetsau chalats mehem

Hebrew: בַּיהֹוָ֣ה בָּגָ֔דוּ כִּי־בָנִ֥ים זָרִ֖ים יָלָ֑דוּ עַתָּ֛ה יֹאכְלֵ֥ם חֹ֖דֶשׁ אֶת־חֶלְקֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
[Because] they have broken faith with GOD,
Because they have begotten
Alien children.
Therefore, the new moon
Shall devour their portion.
Transliteration: vayhovah vagadu khiy-vaniym zariym yaladu atah yokhelem chodesh et-chelekeyhem {s}

Hebrew: תִּקְע֤וּ שׁוֹפָר֙ בַּגִּבְעָ֔ה חֲצֹצְרָ֖ה בָּרָמָ֑ה הָרִ֙יעוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ בִּנְיָמִֽין׃
Translated:
Sound a ram’s horn in Gibeah,
A trumpet in Ramah;
Give the alarm in Beth-aven;
After you, Benjamin!
Transliteration: tikeu shvofar vagiveah chatsotserah varamah hariyu veyt aven achareykha vineyamiyn

Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה תִֽהְיֶ֔ה בְּי֖וֹם תּוֹכֵחָ֑ה בְּשִׁבְטֵי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הוֹדַ֖עְתִּי נֶאֱמָנָֽה׃
Translated:
Ephraim is stricken with horror
On a day of chastisement.
Against the tribes of Israel
I proclaim certainties:
Transliteration: eferayiim leshamah tiheyeh veyvom tvokhechah veshivetey yisherael hvodaetiy neemanah

Hebrew: הָיוּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה כְּמַסִּיגֵ֖י גְּב֑וּל עֲלֵיהֶ֕ם אֶשְׁפּ֥וֹךְ כַּמַּ֖יִם עֶבְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
The officers of Judah have acted
Like shifters of field boundaries;
On them I will pour out
My wrath like water.
Transliteration: hayu sharey yehudah khemasiygey gevul aleyhem eshefvokhe khamayiim everatiy

Hebrew: עָשׁ֥וּק אֶפְרַ֖יִם רְצ֣וּץ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּ֣י הוֹאִ֔יל הָלַ֖ךְ אַחֲרֵי־צָֽו׃
Translated:
Ephraim is defrauded,
Robbed of redress,
Because he has witlessly
Gone after futility.
Transliteration: ashuk eferayiim retsuts mishefat khiy hvoiyl halakhe acharey-tsav

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֥י כָעָ֖שׁ לְאֶפְרָ֑יִם וְכָרָקָ֖ב לְבֵ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated:
For it is I who am like rot to Ephraim,
Like decay to the House of Judah;
Transliteration: vaaniy khaash leeferayiim vekharakav leveyt yehudah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא אֶפְרַ֜יִם אֶת־חׇלְי֗וֹ וִֽיהוּדָה֙ אֶת־מְזֹר֔וֹ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־אַשּׁ֔וּר וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יָרֵ֑ב וְה֗וּא לֹ֤א יוּכַל֙ לִרְפֹּ֣א לָכֶ֔ם וְלֹא־יִגְהֶ֥ה מִכֶּ֖ם מָזֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Yet when Ephraim became aware of his sickness,
Judah of his sores,
Ephraim repaired to Assyria—
He sent envoys to a patron king!
He will never be able to cure you,
Will not heal you of your sores.
Transliteration: vayare eferayiim et-chׇleyvo viyhudah et-mezorvo vayelekhe eferayiim el-ashur vayishelach el-melekhe yarev vehu lo yukhal lirefo lakhem velo-yigeheh mikhem mazvor

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֤י כַשַּׁ֙חַל֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם וְכַכְּפִ֖יר לְבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲנִ֨י אֲנִ֤י אֶטְרֹף֙ וְאֵלֵ֔ךְ אֶשָּׂ֖א וְאֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
No, I will be like a lion to Ephraim,
Like a great beast to the House of Judah;
I, I will attack and stride away,
Carrying the prey that no one can rescue;
Transliteration: khiy anokhiy khashachal leeferayiim vekhakhefiyr leveyt yehudah aniy aniy eterof veelekhe esha veeyn matsiyl

Hebrew: אֵלֵ֤ךְ אָשׁ֙וּבָה֙ אֶל־מְקוֹמִ֔י עַ֥ד אֲשֶֽׁר־יֶאְשְׁמ֖וּ וּבִקְשׁ֣וּ פָנָ֑י בַּצַּ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם יְשַׁחֲרֻֽנְנִי׃
Translated:
And I will return to My abode—
Till they realize their guilt.
In their distress, they will seek Me
And beg for My favor.
Transliteration: elekhe ashuvah el-mekvomiy ad asher-yeeshemu uvikeshu fanay vatsar lahem yeshacharuneniy

Hebrew: לְכוּ֙ וְנָשׁ֣וּבָה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י ה֥וּא טָרָ֖ף וְיִרְפָּאֵ֑נוּ יַ֖ךְ וְיַחְבְּשֵֽׁנוּ׃
Translated:
“Come, let us turn back to GOD:
The One who attacked, and so can heal us;
Who wounded, and so can bind us up.
Transliteration: lekhu venashuvah el-yehovah khiy hu taraf veyirefaenu yakhe veyacheveshenu

Hebrew: יְחַיֵּ֖נוּ מִיֹּמָ֑יִם בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י יְקִמֵ֖נוּ וְנִחְיֶ֥ה לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated:
In two days [God] will make us whole again,
And on the third day raise us up;
God’s favor will make us whole.
Transliteration: yechayenu miyomayiim vayyvom hasheliyshiy yekimenu venicheyeh lefanayv

Hebrew: וְנֵדְעָ֣ה נִרְדְּפָ֗ה לָדַ֙עַת֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּשַׁ֖חַר נָכ֣וֹן מֹצָא֑וֹ וְיָב֤וֹא כַגֶּ֙שֶׁם֙ לָ֔נוּ כְּמַלְק֖וֹשׁ י֥וֹרֶה אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Let us pursue devotion to GOD,
And we shall become devout.
As sure as daybreak is God’s appearance,
Which will come to us like rain,
Like latter rain that refreshes the earth.”
Transliteration: venedeah niredefah ladaat et-yehovah kheshachar nakhvon motsavo veyavvo khageshem lanu khemalekvosh yvoreh arets

Hebrew: מָ֤ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לְּךָ֙ אֶפְרַ֔יִם מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂה־לְּךָ֖ יְהוּדָ֑ה וְחַסְדְּכֶם֙ כַּעֲנַן־בֹּ֔קֶר וְכַטַּ֖ל מַשְׁכִּ֥ים הֹלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
What can I do for you, Ephraim,
What can I do for you, Judah,
When your goodness is like morning clouds,
Like dew so early gone?
Transliteration: mah eesheh-lekha eferayiim mah eesheh-lekha yehudah vechasedekhem khaanan-voker vekhatal mashekhiym holekhe

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן חָצַ֙בְתִּי֙ בַּנְּבִיאִ֔ים הֲרַגְתִּ֖ים בְּאִמְרֵי־פִ֑י וּמִשְׁפָּטֶ֖יךָ א֥וֹר יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
That is why I have hewn down the prophets,
Have slain them with the words of My mouth:
And the day that dawned [brought on] your punishment.
Transliteration: al-khen chatsavetiy vaneviyiym haragetiym veimerey-fiy umishefateykha vor eitse

Hebrew: כִּ֛י חֶ֥סֶד חָפַ֖צְתִּי וְלֹא־זָ֑בַח וְדַ֥עַת אֱלֹהִ֖ים מֵעֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
For I desire goodness, not sacrifice;
Devotion to God, rather than burnt offerings.
Transliteration: khiy chesed chafatsetiy velo-zavach vedaat Elohim meolvot

Hebrew: וְהֵ֕מָּה כְּאָדָ֖ם עָבְר֣וּ בְרִ֑ית שָׁ֖ם בָּ֥גְדוּ בִֽי׃
Translated:
But they, as human beings [are wont to do], have transgressed the Covenant.
This is where they have been false to Me:
Transliteration: vehemah kheadam averu veriyt sham vagedu viy

Hebrew: גִּלְעָ֕ד קִרְיַ֖ת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן עֲקֻבָּ֖ה מִדָּֽם׃
Translated:
Gilead is a city of evildoers,
Tracked up with blood.
Transliteration: gilead kireyat foaley aven akuvah midam

Hebrew: וּכְחַכֵּ֨י אִ֜ישׁ גְּדוּדִ֗ים חֶ֚בֶר כֹּהֲנִ֔ים דֶּ֖רֶךְ יְרַצְּחוּ־שֶׁ֑כְמָה כִּ֥י זִמָּ֖ה עָשֽׂוּ׃
Translated:
The gang of priests is
Like the ambuscade of bandits
Who murder on the road to Shechem,
For they have encouraged depravity.
Transliteration: ukhechakhey iysh gedudiym chever khohaniym derekhe yeratsechu-shekhemah khiy zimah ashu

Hebrew: בְּבֵית֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רָאִ֖יתִי (שעריריה) [שַׁעֲרֽוּרִיָּ֑ה] שָׁ֚ם זְנ֣וּת לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם נִטְמָ֖א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
In the House of Israel I have seen
A horrible thing;
Ephraim has fornicated there,
Israel has defiled himself.
Transliteration: veveyt yisherael raiytiy (shryryh) [shaaruriyah] sham zenut leeferayiim nitema yisherael

Hebrew: גַּם־יְהוּדָ֕ה שָׁ֥ת קָצִ֖יר לָ֑ךְ בְּשׁוּבִ֖י שְׁב֥וּת עַמִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
(Even Judah has reaped a harvest of you!)
When I would restore My people’s fortunes,
Transliteration: gam-yehudah shat katsiyr lakhe veshuviy shevut amiy {f}

Hebrew: כְּרׇפְאִ֣י לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְנִגְלָ֞ה עֲוֺ֤ן אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וְרָע֣וֹת שֹׁמְר֔וֹן כִּ֥י פָעֲל֖וּ שָׁ֑קֶר וְגַנָּ֣ב יָב֔וֹא פָּשַׁ֥ט גְּד֖וּד בַּחֽוּץ׃
Translated:
When I would heal Israel,
The guilt of Ephraim reveals itself
And the wickedness of Samaria.
For they have acted treacherously,
With thieves breaking in
And bands raiding outside.
Transliteration: kherׇfeiy leyisherael venigelah avon eferayiim veravot shomervon khiy faalu shaker veganav yavvo fashat gedud vachuts

Hebrew: וּבַל־יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ לִלְבָבָ֔ם כׇּל־רָעָתָ֖ם זָכָ֑רְתִּי עַתָּה֙ סְבָב֣וּם מַעַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם נֶ֥גֶד פָּנַ֖י הָיֽוּ׃
Translated:
And they do not consider
That I remembered all their wickedness.
Why, their misdeeds have been all around them,
They have been ever before Me.
Transliteration: uval-yomeru lilevavam khׇl-raatam zakharetiy atah sevavum maaleleyhem neged fanay hayu

Hebrew: בְּרָעָתָ֖ם יְשַׂמְּחוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבְכַחֲשֵׁיהֶ֖ם שָׂרִֽים׃
Translated:
In malice they make a king merry,
And officials in treachery.
Transliteration: veraatam yeshamechu-melekhe uvekhachasheyhem shariym

Hebrew: כֻּלָּם֙ מְנָ֣אֲפִ֔ים כְּמ֣וֹ תַנּ֔וּר בֹּעֵ֖רָה מֵאֹפֶ֑ה יִשְׁבּ֣וֹת מֵעִ֔יר מִלּ֥וּשׁ בָּצֵ֖ק עַד־חֻמְצָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
They commit adultery, all of them,
Like an oven fired by a baker,
Who desists from stoking only
From the kneading of the dough to its leavening.
Transliteration: khulam menaafiym khemvo tanur voerah meofeh yishevvot meiyr milush vatsek ad-chumetsatvo

Hebrew: י֣וֹם מַלְכֵּ֔נוּ הֶחֱל֥וּ שָׂרִ֖ים חֲמַ֣ת מִיָּ֑יִן מָשַׁ֥ךְ יָד֖וֹ אֶת־לֹצְצִֽים׃
Translated:
The day they made our king sick
[And] officials with the poison of wine,
He gave his hand to traitors.
Transliteration: yvom malekhenu hechelu shariym chamat miyayiin mashakhe yadvo et-lotsetsiym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קֵרְב֧וּ כַתַּנּ֛וּר לִבָּ֖ם בְּאׇרְבָּ֑ם כׇּל־הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ יָשֵׁ֣ן אֹֽפֵהֶ֔ם בֹּ֕קֶר ה֥וּא בֹעֵ֖ר כְּאֵ֥שׁ לֶהָבָֽה׃
Translated:
For they approach their ambush
With their hearts like an oven:
Through the night
Their baker has slept;
In the morning, it flares up
Like a blazing fire.
Transliteration: khiy-kerevu khatanur livam veׇrevam khׇl-halayelah yashen ofehem voker hu voer kheesh lehavah

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֤ם יֵחַ֙מּוּ֙ כַּתַּנּ֔וּר וְאָכְל֖וּ אֶת־שֹׁפְטֵיהֶ֑ם כׇּל־מַלְכֵיהֶ֣ם נָפָ֔לוּ אֵין־קֹרֵ֥א בָהֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
They all get heated like an oven
And devour their rulers—
None of them calls to Me.
All their kings have fallen [by their hand].
Transliteration: khulam eichamu khatanur veakhelu et-shofeteyhem khׇl-malekheyhem nafalu eyn-kore vahem elay

Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֕יִם בָּעַמִּ֖ים ה֣וּא יִתְבּוֹלָ֑ל אֶפְרַ֛יִם הָיָ֥ה עֻגָ֖ה בְּלִ֥י הֲפוּכָֽה׃
Translated:
Ephraim is among the peoples;
He is rotting away.
Ephraim is like a cake—
Incapable of turning.
Transliteration: eferayiim vaamiym hu yitevvolal eferayiim hayah ugah veliy hafukhah

Hebrew: אָכְל֤וּ זָרִים֙ כֹּח֔וֹ וְה֖וּא לֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע גַּם־שֵׂיבָה֙ זָ֣רְקָה בּ֔וֹ וְה֖וּא לֹ֥א יָדָֽע׃
Translated:
Strangers have consumed his strength,
But he has taken no notice;
Also, mold is scattered over him,
But he has taken no notice.
Transliteration: akhelu zariym khochvo vehu lo yada gam-sheyvah zarekah vvo vehu lo yada

Hebrew: וְעָנָ֥ה גְאֽוֹן־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָנָ֑יו וְלֹא־שָׁ֙בוּ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א בִקְשֻׁ֖הוּ בְּכׇל־זֹֽאת׃
Translated:
Though Israel’s pride has been humbled
Before his very eyes,
They have not turned back
To their God the ETERNAL One—
Whom they have not sought
Despite everything.
Transliteration: veanah gevon-yisherael vefanayv velo-shavu el-yehovah eloheyhem velo vikeshuhu vekhׇl-zot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם כְּיוֹנָ֥ה פוֹתָ֖ה אֵ֣ין לֵ֑ב מִצְרַ֥יִם קָרָ֖אוּ אַשּׁ֥וּר הָלָֽכוּ׃
Translated:
Instead, Ephraim has acted
Like a silly dove with no mind:
They have appealed to Egypt!
They have gone to Assyria!
Transliteration: vayehiy eferayiim kheyvonah fvotah eyn lev mitserayiim karau ashur halakhu

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵלֵ֗כוּ אֶפְר֤וֹשׂ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ רִשְׁתִּ֔י כְּע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם אוֹרִידֵ֑ם אַיְסִירֵ֕ם כְּשֵׁ֖מַע לַעֲדָתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
When they go, I will spread
My net over them,
I will bring them down
Like birds of the sky;
I will chastise them
When I hear their bargaining.
Transliteration: khaasher eilekhu efervosh aleyhem rishetiy khevof hashamayiim voriydem ayesiyrem kheshema laadatam {s}

Hebrew: א֤וֹי לָהֶם֙ כִּֽי־נָדְד֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נִּי שֹׁ֥ד לָהֶ֖ם כִּי־פָ֣שְׁעוּ בִ֑י וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֶפְדֵּ֔ם וְהֵ֕מָּה דִּבְּר֥וּ עָלַ֖י כְּזָבִֽים׃
Translated:
Woe to them
For straying from Me;
Destruction to them
For rebelling against Me!
For I was their Redeemer;
Yet they have plotted treason against Me.
Transliteration: voy lahem khiy-nadedu mimeniy shod lahem khiy-fasheu viy veanokhiy efedem vehemah diveru alay khezaviym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־זָעֲק֤וּ אֵלַי֙ בְּלִבָּ֔ם כִּ֥י יְיֵלִ֖ילוּ עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָ֑ם עַל־דָּגָ֧ן וְתִיר֛וֹשׁ יִתְגּוֹרָ֖רוּ יָס֥וּרוּ בִֽי׃
Translated:
But they did not cry out to Me sincerely
As they lay wailing.
They debauch over new grain and new wine,
They are faithless to Me.
Transliteration: velo-zaaku elay velivam khiy yeeiliylu al-mishekhevvotam al-dagan vetiyrvosh yitegvoraru yasuru viy

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י יִסַּ֔רְתִּי חִזַּ֖קְתִּי זְרוֹעֹתָ֑ם וְאֵלַ֖י יְחַשְּׁבוּ־רָֽע׃
Translated:
I braced, I strengthened their arms,
And they plot evil against Me!
Transliteration: vaaniy yisaretiy chizaketiy zervootam veelay yechashevu-ra

Hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ ׀ לֹ֣א עָ֗ל הָיוּ֙ כְּקֶ֣שֶׁת רְמִיָּ֔ה יִפְּל֥וּ בַחֶ֛רֶב שָׂרֵיהֶ֖ם מִזַּ֣עַם לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם ז֥וֹ לַעְגָּ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
They come back;
They have been of no use,
Like a slack bow.
Their officers shall fall by the sword,
Because of the stammering of their tongues.
Such shall be [the results of] their jabbering
In the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: yashuvu lo al hayu khekeshet remiyah yifelu vacherev shareyhem mizaam leshvonam zvo laegam veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: אֶל־חִכְּךָ֣ שֹׁפָ֔ר כַּנֶּ֖שֶׁר עַל־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה יַ֚עַן עָבְר֣וּ בְרִיתִ֔י וְעַל־תּוֹרָתִ֖י פָּשָֽׁעוּ׃
Translated:
[Put] a ram’s horn to your mouth—
Like an eagle over the House of GOD;
Because they have transgressed My covenant
And been faithless to My teaching.
Transliteration: el-chikhekha shofar khanesher al-veyt yehovah yaan averu veriytiy veal-tvoratiy fashau

Hebrew: לִ֖י יִזְעָ֑קוּ אֱלֹהַ֥י יְֽדַעֲנ֖וּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Israel cries out to Me,
“O my God, we are devoted to You.”
Transliteration: liy yizeaku elohay yedaanukha yisherael

Hebrew: זָנַ֥ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ט֑וֹב אוֹיֵ֖ב יִרְדְּפֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Israel rejects what is good;
An enemy shall pursue him.
Transliteration: zanach yisherael tvov voeiv yiredefvo

Hebrew: הֵ֤ם הִמְלִ֙יכוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א מִמֶּ֔נִּי הֵשִׂ֖ירוּ וְלֹ֣א יָדָ֑עְתִּי כַּסְפָּ֣ם וּזְהָבָ֗ם עָשׂ֤וּ לָהֶם֙ עֲצַבִּ֔ים לְמַ֖עַן יִכָּרֵֽת׃
Translated:
They have made kings,
But not with My sanction;
They have made officers,
But not of My choice.
Of their silver and gold
They have made themselves images,
To their own undoing.
Transliteration: hem himeliykhu velo mimeniy heshiyru velo yadaetiy khasefam uzehavam ashu lahem atsaviym lemaan yikharet

Hebrew: זָנַח֙ עֶגְלֵ֣ךְ שֹׁמְר֔וֹן חָרָ֥ה אַפִּ֖י בָּ֑ם עַד־מָתַ֕י לֹ֥א יוּכְל֖וּ נִקָּיֹֽן׃
Translated:
I reject your calf, Samaria!
I am furious with them!
Will they never be capable of purity?
Transliteration: zanach egelekhe shomervon charah afiy vam ad-matay lo yukhelu nikayon

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְה֔וּא חָרָ֣שׁ עָשָׂ֔הוּ וְלֹ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים ה֑וּא כִּֽי־שְׁבָבִ֣ים יִֽהְיֶ֔ה עֵ֖גֶל שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
For it was Israel’s doing;
It was only made by a joiner,
It is not a god.
No, the calf of Samaria shall be
Reduced to splinters!
Transliteration: khiy miyisherael vehu charash ashahu velo Elohim hu khiy-shevaviym yiheyeh egel shomervon

Hebrew: כִּ֛י ר֥וּחַ יִזְרָ֖עוּ וְסוּפָ֣תָה יִקְצֹ֑רוּ קָמָ֣ה אֵֽין־ל֗וֹ צֶ֚מַח בְּלִ֣י יַעֲשֶׂה־קֶּ֔מַח אוּלַ֣י יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה זָרִ֖ים יִבְלָעֻֽהוּ׃
Translated:
They sow wind,
And they shall reap whirlwind—
Standing stalks devoid of ears
And yielding no flour.
If they do yield any,
Strangers shall devour it.
Transliteration: khiy rucha yizerau vesufatah yiketsoru kamah eyn-lvo tsemach veliy yaasheh-kemach ulay yaasheh zariym yivelauhu

Hebrew: נִבְלַ֖ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַתָּה֙ הָי֣וּ בַגּוֹיִ֔ם כִּכְלִ֖י אֵֽין־חֵ֥פֶץ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Israel is bewildered;
They have now become among the nations
Like an unwanted vessel,
Transliteration: nivela yisherael atah hayu vagvoyim khikheliy eyn-chefets vvo

Hebrew: כִּי־הֵ֙מָּה֙ עָל֣וּ אַשּׁ֔וּר פֶּ֖רֶא בּוֹדֵ֣ד ל֑וֹ אֶפְרַ֖יִם הִתְנ֥וּ אֲהָבִֽים׃
Translated:
[Like] a lonely wild ass.
For they have gone up to Assyria,
Ephraim has courted friendship.
Transliteration: khiy-hemah alu ashur fere vvoded lvo eferayiim hitenu ahaviym

Hebrew: גַּ֛ם כִּֽי־יִתְנ֥וּ בַגּוֹיִ֖ם עַתָּ֣ה אֲקַבְּצֵ֑ם וַיָּחֵ֣לּוּ מְּעָ֔ט מִמַּשָּׂ֖א מֶ֥לֶךְ שָׂרִֽים׃
Translated:
And while they are courting among the nations,
There I will hold them fast;
And they shall begin to diminish in number
From the burden of king [and] officers.
Transliteration: gam khiy-yitenu vagvoyim atah akavetsem vayachelu meat mimasha melekhe shariym

Hebrew: כִּי־הִרְבָּ֥ה אֶפְרַ֛יִם מִזְבְּח֖וֹת לַחֲטֹ֑א הָיוּ־ל֥וֹ מִזְבְּח֖וֹת לַחֲטֹֽא׃
Translated:
For Ephraim has multiplied altars—for guilt;
His altars have redounded to his guilt:
Transliteration: khiy-hirevah eferayiim mizevechvot lachato hayu-lvo mizevechvot lachato

Hebrew: (אכתוב) [אֶ֨כְתׇּב־]ל֔וֹ (רבו) [רֻבֵּ֖י] תּוֹרָתִ֑י כְּמוֹ־זָ֖ר נֶחְשָֽׁבוּ׃
Translated:
The many teachings I wrote for him
Have been treated as something alien.
Transliteration: (khtvv) [ekhetׇv-]lvo (rvv) [ruvey] tvoratiy khemvo-zar necheshavu

Hebrew: זִבְחֵ֣י הַבְהָבַ֗י יִזְבְּח֤וּ בָשָׂר֙ וַיֹּאכֵ֔לוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֣א רָצָ֑ם עַתָּ֞ה יִזְכֹּ֤ר עֲוֺנָם֙ וְיִפְקֹ֣ד חַטֹּאותָ֔ם הֵ֖מָּה מִצְרַ֥יִם יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃
Translated:
When they present sacrifices to Me,
It is but flesh for them to eat:
GOD has not accepted them.
Behold, their iniquities will be remembered,
Their sins will be punished:
Back to Egypt with them!
Transliteration: zivechey havehavay yizevechu vashar vayokhelu yehovah lo ratsam atah yizekhor avonam veyifekod chatovtam hemah mitserayiim yashuvu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֨ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־עֹשֵׂ֗הוּ וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ הֵיכָל֔וֹת וִיהוּדָ֕ה הִרְבָּ֖ה עָרִ֣ים בְּצֻר֑וֹת וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי־אֵ֣שׁ בְּעָרָ֔יו וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Israel has ignored his Maker
And built temples
(And Judah has fortified many cities).
So I will set fire to his cities,
And it shall consume their fortresses.
Transliteration: vayishekhach yisherael et-oshehu vayiven heykhalvot viyhudah hirevah ariym vetsurvot veshilachetiy-esh vearayv veakhelah aremenoteyha {f}

Hebrew: אַל־תִּשְׂמַ֨ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל <small>׀</small> אֶל־גִּיל֙ כָּעַמִּ֔ים כִּ֥י זָנִ֖יתָ מֵעַ֣ל אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אָהַ֣בְתָּ אֶתְנָ֔ן עַ֖ל כׇּל־גׇּרְנ֥וֹת דָּגָֽן׃
Translated:
Rejoice not, O Israel,
As other peoples exult;
For you have strayed
Away from your God:
You have loved a prostitute’s fee
By every threshing floor of new grain.
Transliteration: al-tishemach yisherael <small></small> el-giyl khaamiym khiy zaniyta meal eloheykha ahaveta etenan al khׇl-gׇrenvot dagan

Hebrew: גֹּ֥רֶן וָיֶ֖קֶב לֹ֣א יִרְעֵ֑ם וְתִיר֖וֹשׁ יְכַ֥חֶשׁ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Threshing floor and winepress
Shall not join them,
And the new wine shall betray her.
Transliteration: goren vayekev lo yireem vetiyrvosh yekhachesh vah

Hebrew: לֹ֥א יֵשְׁב֖וּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשָׁ֤ב אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ מִצְרַ֔יִם וּבְאַשּׁ֖וּר טָמֵ֥א יֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated:
They shall not be able to remain
In GOD’s land.
But Ephraim shall return to Egypt
And shall eat impure food in Assyria.
Transliteration: lo eishevu veerets yehovah veshav eferayiim mitserayiim uveashur tame yokhelu

Hebrew: לֹא־יִסְּכ֨וּ לַיהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> יַ֘יִן֮ וְלֹ֣א יֶעֶרְבוּ־לוֹ֒ זִבְחֵיהֶ֗ם כְּלֶ֤חֶם אוֹנִים֙ לָהֶ֔ם כׇּל־אֹכְלָ֖יו יִטַּמָּ֑אוּ כִּֽי־לַחְמָ֣ם לְנַפְשָׁ֔ם לֹ֥א יָב֖וֹא בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
It shall be for them like the food of mourners,
All who partake of which are defiled.
They will offer no libations of wine to GOD,
And no sacrifices of theirs will please;
But their food will be only for their hunger,
It shall not come into the House of GOD.
Transliteration: lo-yisekhu layhovah <small></small> yayiin velo yeerevu-lvo zivecheyhem khelechem voniym lahem khׇl-okhelayv yitamau khiy-lachemam lenafesham lo yavvo veyt yehovah

Hebrew: מַֽה־תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ לְי֣וֹם מוֹעֵ֑ד וּלְי֖וֹם חַג־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
What will you do about feast days,
About the festivals of GOD?
Transliteration: mah-taashu leyvom mvoed uleyvom chag-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה הָֽלְכוּ֙ מִשֹּׁ֔ד מִצְרַ֥יִם תְּקַבְּצֵ֖ם מֹ֣ף תְּקַבְּרֵ֑ם מַחְמַ֣ד לְכַסְפָּ֗ם קִמּוֹשׂ֙ יִֽירָשֵׁ֔ם ח֖וֹחַ בְּאׇהֳלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Behold, they have gone from destruction
[With] the silver they treasure.
Egypt shall hold them fast,
Moph shall receive them in burial.
Weeds are their heirs;
Prickly shrubs occupy their [old] homes.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh halekhu mishod mitserayiim tekavetsem mof tekaverem machemad lekhasefam kimvosh yiyrashem chvocha veׇholeyhem

Hebrew: בָּ֣אוּ ׀ יְמֵ֣י הַפְּקֻדָּ֗ה בָּ֚אוּ יְמֵ֣י הַשִּׁלֻּ֔ם יֵדְע֖וּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֱוִ֣יל הַנָּבִ֗יא מְשֻׁגָּע֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָר֔וּחַ עַ֚ל רֹ֣ב עֲוֺנְךָ֔ וְרַבָּ֖ה מַשְׂטֵמָֽה׃
Translated:
The days of punishment have come
For your heavy guilt;
The days of requital have come—
Let Israel know it!
The prophet was distraught,
The inspired man driven mad
By constant harassment.
Transliteration: vau yemey hafekudah vau yemey hashilum eideu yisherael eviyl hanaviy meshuga iysh harucha al rov avonekha veravah mashetemah

Hebrew: צֹפֶ֥ה אֶפְרַ֖יִם עִם־אֱלֹהָ֑י נָבִ֞יא פַּ֤ח יָקוֹשׁ֙ עַל־כׇּל־דְּרָכָ֔יו מַשְׂטֵמָ֖ה בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated:
Ephraim watches for my God.
As for the prophet,
Fowlers’ snares are on all his paths,
Harassment in the House of his God.
Transliteration: tsofeh eferayiim im-elohay naviy fach yakvosh al-khׇl-derakhayv mashetemah veveyt elohayv

Hebrew: הֶעְמִ֥יקוּ שִׁחֵ֖תוּ כִּימֵ֣י הַגִּבְעָ֑ה יִזְכּ֣וֹר עֲוֺנָ֔ם יִפְק֖וֹד חַטֹּאותָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
They have been as grievously corrupt
As in the days of Gibeah;
[God] will remember their iniquity,
And will punish their sins.
Transliteration: heemiyku shichetu khiymey hagiveah yizekhvor avonam yifekvod chatovtam {s}

Hebrew: כַּעֲנָבִ֣ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר מָצָ֙אתִי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּבִכּוּרָ֤הֿ בִתְאֵנָה֙ בְּרֵ֣אשִׁיתָ֔הּ רָאִ֖יתִי אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם הֵ֜מָּה בָּ֣אוּ בַֽעַל־פְּע֗וֹר וַיִּנָּֽזְרוּ֙ לַבֹּ֔שֶׁת וַיִּהְי֥וּ שִׁקּוּצִ֖ים כְּאׇהֳבָֽם׃
Translated:
I found Israel [as pleasing]
As grapes in the wilderness;
Your ancestors seemed to Me
Like the first fig to ripen on a fig tree.
But when they came to Baal-peor,
They turned aside to shamefulness;
Then they became as detested
As they had been loved.
Transliteration: khaanaviym vamidevar matsatiy yisherael khevikhurahֿ viteenah vereshiytah raiytiy avvoteykhem hemah vau vaal-fevor vayinazeru lavoshet vayiheyu shikutsiym kheׇhovam

Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֕יִם כָּע֖וֹף יִתְעוֹפֵ֣ף כְּבוֹדָ֑ם מִלֵּדָ֥ה וּמִבֶּ֖טֶן וּמֵהֵרָיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
From birth, from the womb, from conception
Ephraim’s glory shall be
Like birds that fly away.
Transliteration: eferayiim khavof yitevofef khevvodam miledah umiveten umeherayvon

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִם־יְגַדְּלוּ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וְשִׁכַּלְתִּ֖ים מֵאָדָ֑ם כִּֽי־גַם־א֥וֹי לָהֶ֖ם בְּשׂוּרִ֥י מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Even if they rear their infants,
I will bereave them of everyone.
Woe to them indeed
When I turn away from them!
Transliteration: khiy im-yegadelu et-veneyhem veshikhaletiym meadam khiy-gam-voy lahem veshuriy mehem

Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֛יִם כַּאֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֥יתִי לְצ֖וֹר שְׁתוּלָ֣ה בְנָוֶ֑ה וְאֶפְרַ֕יִם לְהוֹצִ֥יא אֶל־הֹרֵ֖ג בָּנָֽיו׃
Translated:
It shall go with Ephraim
As I have seen it go with Tyre,
Which was planted in a meadow;
Ephraim too must bring out
His children to slayers.
Transliteration: eferayiim khaasher-raiytiy letsvor shetulah venaveh veeferayiim lehvotsiy el-horeg vanayv

Hebrew: תֵּן־לָהֶ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה מַה־תִּתֵּ֑ן תֵּן־לָהֶם֙ רֶ֣חֶם מַשְׁכִּ֔יל וְשָׁדַ֖יִם צֹמְקִֽים׃
Translated:
Give them, O ETERNAL One—give them what?
Give them a womb that miscarries,
And shriveled breasts!
Transliteration: ten-lahem yehovah mah-titen ten-lahem rechem mashekhiyl veshadayiim tsomekiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־רָעָתָ֤ם בַּגִּלְגָּל֙ כִּי־שָׁ֣ם שְׂנֵאתִ֔ים עַ֚ל רֹ֣עַ מַעַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם מִבֵּיתִ֖י אֲגָרְשֵׁ֑ם לֹ֤א אוֹסֵף֙ אַהֲבָתָ֔ם כׇּל־שָׂרֵיהֶ֖ם סֹרְרִֽים׃
Translated:
All their misfortune [began] at Gilgal,
For there I disowned them.
For their evil deeds
I will drive them out of My House.
I will accept them no more;
All their officials are disloyal.
Transliteration: khׇl-raatam vagilegal khiy-sham shenetiym al roa maaleleyhem miveytiy agareshem lo vosef ahavatam khׇl-shareyhem soreriym

Hebrew: הֻכָּ֣ה אֶפְרַ֔יִם שׇׁרְשָׁ֥ם יָבֵ֖שׁ פְּרִ֣י (בלי) [בַֽל־]יַעֲשׂ֑וּן גַּ֚ם כִּ֣י יֵלֵד֔וּן וְהֵמַתִּ֖י מַחֲמַדֵּ֥י בִטְנָֽם׃
Translated:
Ephraim is stricken,
Their stock is withered;
They can produce no fruit.
Even if they do bear children,
I will slay their cherished offspring.
Transliteration: hukhah eferayiim shׇresham yavesh feriy (vly) [val-]yaashun gam khiy eiledun vehematiy machamadey vitenam

Hebrew: יִמְאָסֵ֣ם אֱלֹהַ֔י כִּ֛י לֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ ל֑וֹ וְיִֽהְי֥וּ נֹדְדִ֖ים בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
My God rejects them
Because they have not obeyed,
And they shall go wandering
Among the nations.
Transliteration: yimeasem elohay khiy lo shameu lvo veyiheyu nodediym vagvoyim {s}

Hebrew: גֶּ֤פֶן בּוֹקֵק֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל פְּרִ֖י יְשַׁוֶּה־לּ֑וֹ כְּרֹ֣ב לְפִרְי֗וֹ הִרְבָּה֙ לַֽמִּזְבְּח֔וֹת כְּט֣וֹב לְאַרְצ֔וֹ הֵיטִ֖יבוּ מַצֵּבֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Israel is a ravaged vine
And its fruit is like it.
When his fruit was plentiful,
He made altars aplenty;
When his land was bountiful,
Cult pillars abounded.
Transliteration: gefen vvokek yisherael feriy yeshaveh-lvo kherov lefireyvo hirevah lamizevechvot khetvov learetsvo heytiyvu matsevvot

Hebrew: חָלַ֥ק לִבָּ֖ם עַתָּ֣ה יֶאְשָׁ֑מוּ ה֚וּא יַעֲרֹ֣ף מִזְבְּחוֹתָ֔ם יְשֹׁדֵ֖ד מַצֵּבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Now that his boughs are broken up,
He feels his guilt;
He himself pulls apart his altars,
Smashes his pillars.
Transliteration: chalak livam atah yeeshamu hu yaarof mizevechvotam yeshoded matsevvotam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ יֹֽאמְר֔וּ אֵ֥ין מֶ֖לֶךְ לָ֑נוּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָרֵ֙אנוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Truly, now they say,
“We have no king;
For, since we do not fear GOD,
What can a king do to us?”
Transliteration: khiy atah yomeru eyn melekhe lanu khiy lo yarenu et-yehovah vehamelekhe mah-yaasheh-lanu

Hebrew: דִּבְּר֣וּ דְבָרִ֔ים אָל֥וֹת שָׁ֖וְא כָּרֹ֣ת בְּרִ֑ית וּפָרַ֤ח כָּרֹאשׁ֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט עַ֖ל תַּלְמֵ֥י שָׂדָֽי׃
Translated:
So they conclude agreements and make covenants
With false oaths,
And justice degenerates into poison weeds,
Breaking out on the furrows of the fields.
Transliteration: diveru devariym alvot shave kharot veriyt ufarach kharosh mishefat al talemey shaday

Hebrew: לְעֶגְלוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן יָג֖וּרוּ שְׁכַ֣ן שֹׁמְר֑וֹן כִּֽי־אָבַ֨ל עָלָ֜יו עַמּ֗וֹ וּכְמָרָיו֙ עָלָ֣יו יָגִ֔ילוּ עַל־כְּבוֹד֖וֹ כִּי־גָלָ֥ה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
The inhabitants of Samaria fear
For the calf of Beth-aven;
Indeed, its people and priestlings,
Whose joy it once was,
Mourn over it for the glory
That is departed from it.
Transliteration: leegelvot veyt aven yaguru shekhan shomervon khiy-aval alayv amvo ukhemarayv alayv yagiylu al-khevvodvo khiy-galah mimenu

Hebrew: גַּם־אוֹתוֹ֙ לְאַשּׁ֣וּר יוּבָ֔ל מִנְחָ֖ה לְמֶ֣לֶךְ יָרֵ֑ב בׇּשְׁנָה֙ אֶפְרַ֣יִם יִקָּ֔ח וְיֵב֥וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעֲצָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
It too shall be brought to Assyria
As tribute to a patron king;
Ephraim shall be chagrined,
Israel shall be dismayed
Because of his plans.
Transliteration: gam-votvo leashur yuval minechah lemelekhe yarev vׇshenah eferayiim yikach veeivvosh yisherael meatsatvo

Hebrew: נִדְמֶ֥ה שֹׁמְר֖וֹן מַלְכָּ֑הּ כְּקֶ֖צֶף עַל־פְּנֵי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Samaria’s monarchy is vanishing
Like foam upon water,
Transliteration: nidemeh shomervon malekhah kheketsef al-feney-mayiim

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁמְד֞וּ בָּמ֣וֹת אָ֗וֶן חַטַּאת֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל ק֣וֹץ וְדַרְדַּ֔ר יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־מִזְבְּחוֹתָ֑ם וְאָמְר֤וּ לֶהָרִים֙ כַּסּ֔וּנוּ וְלַגְּבָע֖וֹת נִפְל֥וּ עָלֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Ruined shall be the shrines of [Beth-]aven,
That sin of Israel.
Thorns and thistles
Shall grow on their altars.
They shall call to the mountains, “Bury us!”
To the hills, “Fall on us!”
Transliteration: venishemedu vamvot aven chatat yisherael kvots vedaredar yaaleh al-mizevechvotam veameru lehariym khasunu velagevavot nifelu aleynu {f}

Hebrew: מִימֵי֙ הַגִּבְעָ֔ה חָטָ֖אתָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל שָׁ֣ם עָמָ֔דוּ לֹא־תַשִּׂיגֵ֧ם בַּגִּבְעָ֛ה מִלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י עַֽלְוָֽה׃
Translated:
You have sinned more, O Israel,
Than in the days of Gibeah.
There they stand [as] at Gibeah!
Shall they not be overtaken
By a war upon scoundrels
Transliteration: miymey hagiveah chatata yisherael sham amadu lo-tashiygem vagiveah milechamah al-veney alevah

Hebrew: בְּאַוָּתִ֖י וְאֶסֳּרֵ֑ם וְאֻסְּפ֤וּ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ עַמִּ֔ים בְּאׇסְרָ֖ם לִשְׁתֵּ֥י (עינתם) [עוֹנֹתָֽם]׃
Translated:
As peoples gather against them?
When I chose [them], I broke them in,
Harnessing them for two furrows.
Transliteration: veavatiy veesorem veusefu aleyhem amiym veׇseram lishetey (yntm) [vonotam]

Hebrew: וְאֶפְרַ֜יִם עֶגְלָ֤ה מְלֻמָּדָה֙ אֹהַ֣בְתִּי לָד֔וּשׁ וַאֲנִ֣י עָבַ֔רְתִּי עַל־ט֖וּב צַוָּארָ֑הּ אַרְכִּ֤יב אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ יַחֲר֣וֹשׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה יְשַׂדֶּד־ל֖וֹ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
Ephraim became a trained heifer,
But preferred to thresh;
I placed a yoke
Upon her sleek neck.
I will make Ephraim do advance plowing;
Judah shall do [main] plowing!
Jacob shall do final plowing!
Transliteration: veeferayiim egelah melumadah ohavetiy ladush vaaniy avaretiy al-tuv tsavarah arekhiyv eferayiim yacharvosh yehudah yeshaded-lvo yaakov

Hebrew: זִרְע֨וּ לָכֶ֤ם לִצְדָקָה֙ קִצְר֣וּ לְפִי־חֶ֔סֶד נִ֥ירוּ לָכֶ֖ם נִ֑יר וְעֵת֙ לִדְר֣וֹשׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַד־יָב֕וֹא וְיֹרֶ֥ה צֶ֖דֶק לָכֶֽם׃
Translated:
“Sow righteousness for yourselves;
Reap the fruits of goodness;
Break for yourselves betimes fresh ground
Of seeking GOD,
So that you may obtain a teacher of righteousness.”
Transliteration: zireu lakhem litsedakah kitseru lefiy-chesed niyru lakhem niyr veet lidervosh et-yehovah ad-yavvo veyoreh tsedek lakhem

Hebrew: חֲרַשְׁתֶּם־רֶ֛שַׁע עַוְלָ֥תָה קְצַרְתֶּ֖ם אֲכַלְתֶּ֣ם פְּרִי־כָ֑חַשׁ כִּי־בָטַ֥חְתָּ בְדַרְכְּךָ֖ בְּרֹ֥ב גִּבּוֹרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You have plowed wickedness,
You have reaped iniquity—
[And] you shall eat the fruits of treachery—
Because you relied on your way,
On your host of warriors.
Transliteration: charashetem-resha avelatah ketsaretem akhaletem feriy-khachash khiy-vatacheta vedarekhekha verov givvoreykha

Hebrew: וְקָ֣אם שָׁאוֹן֮ בְּעַמֶּ֒ךָ֒ וְכׇל־מִבְצָרֶ֣יךָ יוּשַּׁ֔ד כְּשֹׁ֧ד שַֽׁלְמַ֛ן בֵּ֥ית אַֽרְבֵ֖אל בְּי֣וֹם מִלְחָמָ֑ה אֵ֥ם עַל־בָּנִ֖ים רֻטָּֽשָׁה׃
Translated:
But the din of war shall arise in your own people,
And all your fortresses shall be ravaged
As Beth-arbel was ravaged by Shalman
On a day of battle,
When mothers and babes were dashed to death together.
Transliteration: vekam shavon veamekha vekhׇl-mivetsareykha yushad kheshod shaleman veyt arevel veyvom milechamah em al-vaniym rutashah

Hebrew: כָּ֗כָה עָשָׂ֤ה לָכֶם֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל מִפְּנֵ֖י רָעַ֣ת רָעַתְכֶ֑ם בַּשַּׁ֕חַר נִדְמֹ֥ה נִדְמָ֖ה מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
This is what Bethel has done to you
For your horrible wickedness:
At dawn shall Israel’s monarchy
Utterly perish.
Transliteration: khakhah ashah lakhem veyt-el mifeney raat raatekhem vashachar nidemoh nidemah melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֛י נַ֥עַר יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וָאֹהֲבֵ֑הוּ וּמִמִּצְרַ֖יִם קָרָ֥אתִי לִבְנִֽי׃
Translated:
I fell in love with Israel
When he was still a child;
And I have called [him] My son
Ever since Egypt.
Transliteration: khiy naar yisherael vaohavehu umimitserayiim karatiy liveniy

Hebrew: קָרְא֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם כֵּ֚ן הָלְכ֣וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם לַבְּעָלִ֣ים יְזַבֵּ֔חוּ וְלַפְּסִלִ֖ים יְקַטֵּרֽוּן׃
Translated:
Thus were they called,
But they went their own way;
They sacrifice to Baalim
And offer to carved images.
Transliteration: kareu lahem khen halekhu mifeneyhem lavealiym yezavechu velafesiliym yekaterun

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֤י תִרְגַּ֙לְתִּי֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם קָחָ֖ם עַל־זְרוֹעֹתָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ כִּ֥י רְפָאתִֽים׃
Translated:
I have pampered Ephraim,
Taking them in My arms;
But they have ignored
My healing care.
Transliteration: veanokhiy tiregaletiy leeferayiim kacham al-zervootayv velo yadeu khiy refatiym

Hebrew: בְּחַבְלֵ֨י אָדָ֤ם אֶמְשְׁכֵם֙ בַּעֲבֹת֣וֹת אַהֲבָ֔ה וָאֶהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם כִּמְרִ֥ימֵי עֹ֖ל עַ֣ל לְחֵיהֶ֑ם וְאַ֥ט אֵלָ֖יו אוֹכִֽיל׃
Translated:
I drew them with human ties,
With cords of love;
But I seemed to them as one
Who imposed a yoke on their jaws,
Though I was offering them food.
Transliteration: vechaveley adam emeshekhem vaavotvot ahavah vaeheyeh lahem khimeriymey ol al lecheyhem veat elayv vokhiyl

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יָשׁוּב֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וְאַשּׁ֖וּר ה֣וּא מַלְכּ֑וֹ כִּ֥י מֵאֲנ֖וּ לָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
No!
They return to the land of Egypt,
And Assyria is their king.
Because they refuse to repent,
Transliteration: lo yashuv el-erets mitserayiim veashur hu malekhvo khiy meanu lashuv

Hebrew: וְחָלָ֥ה חֶ֙רֶב֙ בְּעָרָ֔יו וְכִלְּתָ֥ה בַדָּ֖יו וְאָכָ֑לָה מִֽמֹּעֲצ֖וֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
A sword shall descend upon their towns
And consume their limbs
And devour [them] because of their designs.
Transliteration: vechalah cherev vearayv vekhiletah vadayv veakhalah mimoatsvoteyhem

Hebrew: וְעַמִּ֥י תְלוּאִ֖ים לִמְשׁוּבָתִ֑י וְאֶל־עַל֙ יִקְרָאֻ֔הוּ יַ֖חַד לֹ֥א יְרוֹמֵֽם׃
Translated:
For My people persists
In its defection from Me;
When it is summoned upward,
It does not rise at all.
Transliteration: veamiy teluiym limeshuvatiy veel-al yikerauhu yachad lo yervomem

Hebrew: אֵ֞יךְ אֶתֶּנְךָ֣ אֶפְרַ֗יִם אֲמַגֶּנְךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֚יךְ אֶתֶּנְךָ֣ כְאַדְמָ֔ה אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֖ כִּצְבֹאיִ֑ם נֶהְפַּ֤ךְ עָלַי֙ לִבִּ֔י יַ֖חַד נִכְמְר֥וּ נִחוּמָֽי׃
Translated:
How can I give you up, O Ephraim?
How surrender you, O Israel?
How can I make you like Admah,
Render you like Zeboiim?
I have had a change of heart,
All My tenderness is stirred.
Transliteration: eykhe etenekha eferayiim amagenekha yisherael eykhe etenekha kheademah ashiymekha khitsevoyim nehefakhe alay liviy yachad nikhemeru nichumay

Hebrew: לֹ֤א אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ חֲר֣וֹן אַפִּ֔י לֹ֥א אָשׁ֖וּב לְשַׁחֵ֣ת אֶפְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י אֵ֤ל אָנֹכִי֙ וְלֹא־אִ֔ישׁ בְּקִרְבְּךָ֣ קָד֔וֹשׁ וְלֹ֥א אָב֖וֹא בְּעִֽיר׃
Translated:
I will not act on My wrath,
Will not turn to destroy Ephraim.
For I am God—not human—
The Holy One in your midst:
I will not come in fury.
Transliteration: lo eesheh charvon afiy lo ashuv leshachet eferayiim khiy el anokhiy velo-iysh vekirevekha kadvosh velo avvo veiyr

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה יֵלְכ֖וּ כְּאַרְיֵ֣ה יִשְׁאָ֑ג כִּֽי־ה֣וּא יִשְׁאַ֔ג וְיֶחֶרְד֥וּ בָנִ֖ים מִיָּֽם׃
Translated:
GOD will roar like a lion—
Whom they shall march behind;
With that roar, God’s children shall come
Fluttering out of the west.
Transliteration: acharey yehovah eilekhu kheareeih yisheag khiy-hu yisheag veyecheredu vaniym miyam

Hebrew: יֶחֶרְד֤וּ כְצִפּוֹר֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וּכְיוֹנָ֖ה מֵאֶ֣רֶץ אַשּׁ֑וּר וְהוֹשַׁבְתִּ֥ים עַל־בָּתֵּיהֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
They shall flutter from Egypt like sparrows,
From the land of Assyria like doves;
And I will settle them in their homes
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: yecheredu khetsifvor mimitserayiim ukheyvonah meerets ashur vehvoshavetiym al-vateyhem neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: סְבָבֻ֤נִֽי בְכַ֙חַשׁ֙ אֶפְרַ֔יִם וּבְמִרְמָ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וִיהוּדָ֗ה עֹ֥ד רָד֙ עִם־אֵ֔ל וְעִם־קְדוֹשִׁ֖ים נֶאֱמָֽן׃
Translated:
Ephraim surrounds Me with deceit,
The House of Israel with guile.
(But Judah stands firm with God
And is faithful to the Holy One.)
Transliteration: sevavuniy vekhachash eferayiim uvemiremah veyt yisherael viyhudah od rad im-el veim-kedvoshiym neeman

Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֜יִם רֹעֶ֥ה ר֙וּחַ֙ וְרֹדֵ֣ף קָדִ֔ים כׇּל־הַיּ֕וֹם כָּזָ֥ב וָשֹׁ֖ד יַרְבֶּ֑ה וּבְרִית֙ עִם־אַשּׁ֣וּר יִכְרֹ֔תוּ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן לְמִצְרַ֥יִם יוּבָֽל׃
Translated:
Ephraim tends the wind
And pursues the gale;
He is forever adding
Illusion to calamity.
Now they make a covenant with Assyria,
Now oil is carried to Egypt.
Transliteration: eferayiim roeh rucha verodef kadiym khׇl-hayyvom khazav vashod yareveh uveriyt im-ashur yikherotu veshemen lemitserayiim yuval

Hebrew: וְרִ֥יב לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה עִם־יְהוּדָ֑ה וְלִפְקֹ֤ד עַֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ כִּדְרָכָ֔יו כְּמַעֲלָלָ֖יו יָשִׁ֥יב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
GOD once indicted Judah,
And punished Jacob for his conduct,
Requited him for his deeds.
Transliteration: veriyv layhovah im-yehudah velifekod al-yaakov khiderakhayv khemaalalayv yashiyv lvo

Hebrew: בַּבֶּ֖טֶן עָקַ֣ב אֶת־אָחִ֑יו וּבְאוֹנ֖וֹ שָׂרָ֥ה אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
In the womb he tried to supplant his brother;
Grown to manhood, he strove with a divine being,
Transliteration: vaveten akav et-achiyv uvevonvo sharah et-Elohim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שַׂר אֶל־מַלְאָךְ֙ וַיֻּכָ֔ל בָּכָ֖ה וַיִּתְחַנֶּן־ל֑וֹ בֵּֽית־אֵל֙ יִמְצָאֶ֔נּוּ וְשָׁ֖ם יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
He strove with an angel and prevailed—
The other had to weep and implore him.
At Bethel [Jacob] would meet him,
There to commune with him.
Transliteration: vayashar el-maleakhe vayukhal vakhah vayitechanen-lvo veyt-el yimetsaenu vesham yedaver imanu

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַצְּבָא֑וֹת יְהֹוָ֖ה זִכְרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Yet the ETERNAL, the God of Hosts,
Must be invoked as “ GOD.”
Transliteration: vayhovah elohey hatsevavot yehovah zikhervo

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֖ה בֵּאלֹהֶ֣יךָ תָשׁ֑וּב חֶ֤סֶד וּמִשְׁפָּט֙ שְׁמֹ֔ר וְקַוֵּ֥ה אֶל־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated:
You must return to your God!
Practice goodness and justice,
And constantly trust in your God.
Transliteration: veatah veloheykha tashuv chesed umishefat shemor vekaveh el-eloheykha tamiyd

Hebrew: כְּנַ֗עַן בְּיָד֛וֹ מֹאזְנֵ֥י מִרְמָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׁ֥ק אָהֵֽב׃
Translated:
A trader who uses false balances,
Who loves to overreach,
Transliteration: khenaan veyadvo mozeney miremah laashok ahev

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶפְרַ֔יִם אַ֣ךְ עָשַׁ֔רְתִּי מָצָ֥אתִי א֖וֹן לִ֑י כׇּל־יְגִיעַ֕י לֹ֥א יִמְצְאוּ־לִ֖י עָוֺ֥ן אֲשֶׁר־חֵֽטְא׃
Translated:
Ephraim thinks,
“Ah, I have become rich;
I have gotten power!
All my gains do not amount
To an offense that is real guilt.”
Transliteration: vayomer eferayiim akhe asharetiy matsatiy von liy khׇl-yegiyay lo yimetseu-liy avon asher-chete

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עֹ֛ד אוֹשִֽׁיבְךָ֥ בׇאֳהָלִ֖ים כִּימֵ֥י מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated:
I the ETERNAL have been your God
Ever since the land of Egypt.
I will let you dwell in your tents again
As in the days of old,
Transliteration: veanokhiy yehovah eloheykha meerets mitserayiim od voshiyvekha vׇohaliym khiymey mvoed

Hebrew: וְדִבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ עַל־הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים וְאָנֹכִ֖י חָז֣וֹן הִרְבֵּ֑יתִי וּבְיַ֥ד הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים אֲדַמֶּֽה׃
Translated:
When I spoke to the prophets;
For I granted many visions,
And spoke parables through the prophets.
Transliteration: vedivaretiy al-haneviyiym veanokhiy chazvon hireveytiy uveyad haneviyiym adameh

Hebrew: אִם־גִּלְעָ֥ד אָ֙וֶן֙ אַךְ־שָׁ֣וְא הָי֔וּ בַּגִּלְגָּ֖ל שְׁוָרִ֣ים זִבֵּ֑חוּ גַּ֤ם מִזְבְּחוֹתָם֙ כְּגַלִּ֔ים עַ֖ל תַּלְמֵ֥י שָׂדָֽי׃
Translated:
As for Gilead, it is worthless;
And to no purpose have they
Been sacrificing oxen in Gilgal:
The altars of these are also
Like stone heaps upon a plowed field.
Transliteration: im-gilead aven akhe-shave hayu vagilegal shevariym zivechu gam mizevechvotam khegaliym al talemey shaday

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׂדֵ֣ה אֲרָ֑ם וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ד יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּאִשָּׁ֔ה וּבְאִשָּׁ֖ה שָׁמָֽר׃
Translated:
Then Jacob had to flee to the land of Aram;
There Israel served for a wife,
For a wife he had to guard [sheep].
Transliteration: vayiverach yaakov shedeh aram vayaavod yisherael veishah uveishah shamar

Hebrew: וּבְנָבִ֕יא הֶעֱלָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וּבְנָבִ֖יא נִשְׁמָֽר׃
Translated:
But when GOD
Brought Israel up from Egypt,
It was through a prophet;
Through a prophet they were guarded.
Transliteration: uvenaviy heelah yehovah et-yisherael mimitserayiim uvenaviy nishemar

Hebrew: הִכְעִ֥יס אֶפְרַ֖יִם תַּמְרוּרִ֑ים וְדָמָיו֙ עָלָ֣יו יִטּ֔וֹשׁ וְחֶ֨רְפָּת֔וֹ יָשִׁ֥יב ל֖וֹ אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated:
Ephraim gave bitter offense,
And his Lord cast his crimes upon him
And requited him for his mockery.
Transliteration: hikheiys eferayiim tameruriym vedamayv alayv yitvosh vecherefatvo yashiyv lvo adonayv

Hebrew: כְּדַבֵּ֤ר אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ רְתֵ֔ת נָשָׂ֥א ה֖וּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֶּאְשַׁ֥ם בַּבַּ֖עַל וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated:
When Ephraim spoke piety,
He was exalted in Israel;
But he incurred guilt through Baal,
And so he died.
Transliteration: khedaver eferayiim retet nasha hu veyisherael vayeesham vavaal vayamot

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ יוֹסִ֣פוּ לַחֲטֹ֗א וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶם֩ מַסֵּכָ֨ה מִכַּסְפָּ֤ם כִּתְבוּנָם֙ עֲצַבִּ֔ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חָרָשִׁ֖ים כֻּלֹּ֑ה לָהֶם֙ הֵ֣ם אֹמְרִ֔ים זֹבְחֵ֣י אָדָ֔ם עֲגָלִ֖ים יִשָּׁקֽוּן׃
Translated:
And now they go on sinning;
They have made them molten images,
Idols, by their skill, from their silver,
Wholly the work of artisans.
Yet for these they appoint people to sacrifice;
They are wont to kiss calves!
Transliteration: veatah yvosifu lachato vayaashu lahem masekhah mikhasefam khitevunam atsaviym maasheh charashiym khuloh lahem hem omeriym zovechey adam agaliym yishakun

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יִֽהְיוּ֙ כַּעֲנַן־בֹּ֔קֶר וְכַטַּ֖ל מַשְׁכִּ֣ים הֹלֵ֑ךְ כְּמֹץ֙ יְסֹעֵ֣ר מִגֹּ֔רֶן וּכְעָשָׁ֖ן מֵאֲרֻבָּֽה׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
They shall be like morning clouds,
Like dew so early gone;
Like chaff whirled away from the threshing floor.
And like smoke from a lattice.
Transliteration: lakhen yiheyu khaanan-voker vekhatal mashekhiym holekhe khemots yesoer migoren ukheashan mearuvah

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וֵאלֹהִ֤ים זוּלָתִי֙ לֹ֣א תֵדָ֔ע וּמוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אַ֖יִן בִּלְתִּֽי׃
Translated:
Only I the ETERNAL One have been your God
Ever since the land of Egypt;
You have never known a [true] God but Me,
You have never had a helper other than Me.
Transliteration: veanokhiy yehovah eloheykha meerets mitserayiim velohiym zulatiy lo teda umvoshiya ayiin viletiy

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י יְדַעְתִּ֖יךָ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר בְּאֶ֖רֶץ תַּלְאֻבֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I looked after you in the desert,
In a thirsty land.
Transliteration: aniy yedaetiykha vamidevar veerets taleuvvot

Hebrew: כְּמַרְעִיתָם֙ וַיִּשְׂבָּ֔עוּ שָׂבְע֖וּ וַיָּ֣רׇם לִבָּ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֖ן שְׁכֵחֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
When they grazed, they were sated;
When they were sated, they grew haughty;
And so they forgot Me.
Transliteration: khemareiytam vayishevau shaveu vayarׇm livam al-khen shekhechuniy

Hebrew: וָאֱהִ֥י לָהֶ֖ם כְּמוֹ־שָׁ֑חַל כְּנָמֵ֖ר עַל־דֶּ֥רֶךְ אָשֽׁוּר׃
Translated:
So I am become like a lion to them,
Like a leopard I lurk on the way;
Transliteration: vaehiy lahem khemvo-shachal khenamer al-derekhe ashur

Hebrew: אֶפְגְּשֵׁם֙ כְּדֹ֣ב שַׁכּ֔וּל וְאֶקְרַ֖ע סְג֣וֹר לִבָּ֑ם וְאֹכְלֵ֥ם שָׁם֙ כְּלָבִ֔יא חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה תְּבַקְּעֵֽם׃
Translated:
Like a bear robbed of her young I attack them
And rip open the casing of their hearts;
I will devour them there like a lion,
The beasts of the field shall mangle them.
Transliteration: efegeshem khedov shakhul veekera segvor livam veokhelem sham khelaviy chayat hashadeh tevakeem

Hebrew: שִׁחֶתְךָ֥ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כִּי־בִ֥י בְעֶזְרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You are undone, O Israel!
You had no help but Me.
Transliteration: shichetekha yisherael khiy-viy veezerekha

Hebrew: אֱהִ֤י מַלְכְּךָ֙ אֵפ֔וֹא וְיוֹשִׁיעֲךָ֖ בְּכׇל־עָרֶ֑יךָ וְשֹׁ֣פְטֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְתָּ תְּנָה־לִּ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ וְשָׂרִֽים׃
Translated:
Where now is your king?
Let him save you!
Where are the chieftains in all your towns
From whom you demanded:
“Give me a king and officers”?
Transliteration: ehiy malekhekha efvo veyvoshiyakha vekhׇl-areykha veshofeteykha asher amareta tenah-liy melekhe veshariym

Hebrew: אֶֽתֶּן־לְךָ֥ מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּאַפִּ֔י וְאֶקַּ֖ח בְּעֶבְרָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
I give you kings in My ire,
And take them away in My wrath.
Transliteration: eten-lekha melekhe veafiy veekach veeveratiy {f}

Hebrew: צָרוּר֙ עֲוֺ֣ן אֶפְרָ֔יִם צְפוּנָ֖ה חַטָּאתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Ephraim’s guilt is bound up,
His sin is stored away.
Transliteration: tsarur avon eferayiim tsefunah chatatvo

Hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֥י יוֹלֵדָ֖ה יָבֹ֣אוּ ל֑וֹ הוּא־בֵן֙ לֹ֣א חָכָ֔ם כִּי־עֵ֥ת לֹֽא־יַעֲמֹ֖ד בְּמִשְׁבַּ֥ר בָּנִֽים׃
Translated:
Pangs of childbirth assail him,
And the babe is not wise—
For this is no time to survive
At the birthstool of babes.
Transliteration: cheveley yvoledah yavou lvo hu-ven lo chakham khiy-et lo-yaamod vemishevar vaniym

Hebrew: מִיַּ֤ד שְׁאוֹל֙ אֶפְדֵּ֔ם מִמָּ֖וֶת אֶגְאָלֵ֑ם אֱהִ֨י דְבָרֶ֜יךָ מָ֗וֶת אֱהִ֤י קׇֽטׇבְךָ֙ שְׁא֔וֹל נֹ֖חַם יִסָּתֵ֥ר מֵעֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
From Sheol itself I will save them,
Redeem them from very Death.
Where, O Death, are your plagues?
Your pestilence where, O Sheol?
Revenge shall be far from My thoughts.
Transliteration: miyad shevol efedem mimavet egealem ehiy devareykha mavet ehiy kׇtׇvekha shevol nocham yisater meeynay

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ה֔וּא בֵּ֥ין אַחִ֖ים יַפְרִ֑יא יָב֣וֹא קָדִים֩ ר֨וּחַ יְהֹוָ֜ה מִמִּדְבָּ֣ר עֹלֶ֗ה וְיֵב֤וֹשׁ מְקוֹרוֹ֙ וְיֶחֱרַ֣ב מַעְיָנ֔וֹ ה֣וּא יִשְׁסֶ֔ה אוֹצַ֖ר כׇּל־כְּלִ֥י חֶמְדָּֽה׃
Translated:
For though he flourish among reeds,
A blast, a wind of GOD,
Shall come blowing up from the wilderness;
His fountain shall be parched,
His spring dried up.
That [wind] shall plunder treasures,
Every lovely object.
Transliteration: khiy hu veyn achiym yaferiy yavvo kadiym rucha yehovah mimidevar oleh veeivvosh mekvorvo veyecherav maeyanvo hu yisheseh votsar khׇl-kheliy chemedah

Hebrew: תֶּאְשַׁם֙ שֹׁמְר֔וֹן כִּ֥י מָרְתָ֖ה בֵּאלֹהֶ֑יהָ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֔לוּ עֹלְלֵיהֶ֣ם יְרֻטָּ֔שׁוּ וְהָרִיּוֹתָ֖יו יְבֻקָּֽעוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Samaria must bear her guilt,
For she has defied her God.
They shall fall by the sword,
Their infants shall be dashed to death,
And their women with child ripped open.
Transliteration: teesham shomervon khiy maretah veloheyha vacherev yifolu oleleyhem yerutashu vehariyyvotayv yevukau {f}

Hebrew: שׁ֚וּבָה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּ֥י כָשַׁ֖לְתָּ בַּעֲוֺנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Return, O Israel, to the ETERNAL your God,
For you have fallen because of your sin.
Transliteration: shuvah yisherael ad yehovah eloheykha khiy khashaleta vaavonekha

Hebrew: קְח֤וּ עִמָּכֶם֙ דְּבָרִ֔ים וְשׁ֖וּבוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה אִמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כׇּל־תִּשָּׂ֤א עָוֺן֙ וְקַח־ט֔וֹב וּֽנְשַׁלְּמָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים שְׂפָתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Take words with you
And return to GOD.
Say:
“Forgive all guilt
And accept what is good;
Instead of bulls we will pay
[The offering of] our lips.
Transliteration: kechu imakhem devariym veshuvu el-yehovah imeru elayv khׇl-tisha avon vekach-tvov uneshalemah fariym shefateynu

Hebrew: אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀ לֹ֣א יוֹשִׁיעֵ֗נוּ עַל־סוּס֙ לֹ֣א נִרְכָּ֔ב וְלֹא־נֹ֥אמַר ע֛וֹד אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֵ֑ינוּ אֲשֶׁר־בְּךָ֖ יְרֻחַ֥ם יָתֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Assyria shall not save us,
No more will we ride on steeds;
Nor ever again will we call
Our handiwork our god,
Since in You alone orphans find pity!”
Transliteration: ashur lo yvoshiyenu al-sus lo nirekhav velo-nomar vod eloheynu lemaasheh yadeynu asher-vekha yerucham yatvom

Hebrew: אֶרְפָּא֙ מְשׁ֣וּבָתָ֔ם אֹהֲבֵ֖ם נְדָבָ֑ה כִּ֛י שָׁ֥ב אַפִּ֖י מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
I will heal their affliction,
Generously will I take them back in love;
For My anger has turned away from them.
Transliteration: erefa meshuvatam ohavem nedavah khiy shav afiy mimenu

Hebrew: אֶהְיֶ֤ה כַטַּל֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִפְרַ֖ח כַּשּׁוֹשַׁנָּ֑ה וְיַ֥ךְ שׇׁרָשָׁ֖יו כַּלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
I will be to Israel like dew;
He shall blossom like the lily,
He shall strike root like a Lebanon tree.
Transliteration: eheyeh khatal leyisherael yiferach khashvoshanah veyakhe shׇrashayv khalevanvon

Hebrew: יֵֽלְכוּ֙ יֹֽנְקוֹתָ֔יו וִיהִ֥י כַזַּ֖יִת הוֹד֑וֹ וְרֵ֥יחַֽ ל֖וֹ כַּלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
His boughs shall spread out far,
His beauty shall be like the olive tree’s,
His fragrance like that of Lebanon.
Transliteration: eilekhu yonekvotayv viyhiy khazayiit hvodvo vereycha lvo khalevanvon

Hebrew: יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י בְצִלּ֔וֹ יְחַיּ֥וּ דָגָ֖ן וְיִפְרְח֣וּ כַגָּ֑פֶן זִכְר֖וֹ כְּיֵ֥ין לְבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
They who sit in his shade shall be revived:
They shall bring to life new grain,
They shall blossom like the vine;
His scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
Transliteration: yashuvu yoshevey vetsilvo yechayyu dagan veyiferechu khagafen zikhervo kheeiyn levanvon

Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֕יִם מַה־לִּ֥י ע֖וֹד לָעֲצַבִּ֑ים אֲנִ֧י עָנִ֣יתִי וַאֲשׁוּרֶ֗נּוּ אֲנִי֙ כִּבְר֣וֹשׁ רַעֲנָ֔ן מִמֶּ֖נִּי פֶּרְיְךָ֥ נִמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
Ephraim [shall say]:
“What more have I to do with idols?
When I respond and look to [God],
I become like a verdant cypress.”
Your fruit is provided by Me.
Transliteration: eferayiim mah-liy vod laatsaviym aniy aniytiy vaashurenu aniy khivervosh raanan mimeniy fereyekha nimetsa

Hebrew: מִ֤י חָכָם֙ וְיָ֣בֵֽן אֵ֔לֶּה נָב֖וֹן וְיֵדָעֵ֑ם כִּֽי־יְשָׁרִ֞ים דַּרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה וְצַדִּקִים֙ יֵ֣לְכוּ בָ֔ם וּפֹשְׁעִ֖ים יִכָּ֥שְׁלוּ בָֽם׃
Translated:
The wise will consider these words,
The prudent will take note of them.
For the paths of GOD are smooth;
The righteous can walk on them,
While sinners stumble on them.
Transliteration: miy chakham veyaven eleh navvon veeidaem khiy-yeshariym darekhey yehovah vetsadikiym eilekhu vam ufosheiym yikhashelu vam
